Then he will waste his time and get nothing. On the other hand, haste makes people not know [wd1, 2-] how to do [sn8, s-]. So people will do everything. But [wd3, -s] all will reach nothing. Maybe someone can't understand [vp1, -] and asks why it is. Now, let me tell you the reason. I'll show you examples in order to make you understand. Do you hear of the story about "Jin attacks Song". In ancient time [np6, 1-], Jin country [wd3, 1-] wanted attack Song country [wd3, 1-]. The leader ordered a soildier to make marks the day before they studied [wd3, s-]. But in that night, it rained. Someone persuaded the leader to give up the attack. But the leader sticked [fm2,-] [wd3,-] to do [vp5, 2-] what he wanted. So they started. As a result, they can't [vp6,-] find the marks which they [wd5, s-] had been destroyed by the flood [wd3, s-]. They were defeated. From the story, we can know that if you want to achieve your target [cc3,2-], you must think of all factors. Only considering the speed is not appropriate. If you want to become singer [np6, 1-], you should practise [vp1,-] everyday and ask for [vp2, -2] music teacher who will lead you to the true way [cc4,1-]. An old saying has it that haste makes waste. If you want to do something, you should do it step by step. And if you want to fasten your speed, you do it quickly, then maybe you'll find that you have missed something. So [wd5, -s] you have to do it again. And it takes you more time. In daily life, we often meet with such things. So when I was a little girl, my parents and teachers often thought [wd3, -4] me to be cautious. "When you are doing your work", they said, "you must engage in it and most important, you must be careful!" For individual, I think it may be not [wd1, 2-] a serious thing, but if you are in a high position and change of some important things or a lot of money. [sn2,s]Haste will lost [vp9, 1-] [wd3, -2] you much and may lost [wd3, -] your company, your country much [sn8, s-]. Once our English teacher told me a story. Long ago there was a young man who wanted to enter the city with his servent [fm1,-]. They are [vp6, s-] in a boat. [wd4,-2] Sun was coming down so he fastened [wd3, -5] the owner of the boat, an old man. The old man told him slowly, "If you don't fasten [wd3, -1] me I can sent [vp9, 1-] you in [wd3,-] the city before the gate closing. If you fasten [wd3, -], I think I can't do it." The young man didn't believe him, so the old man fastened [wd3, -2] his boat. Suddenly, the bunches of books scattered and in the end, the young man couldn't enter the city. And this is the meaning of the old saying "Haste makes waste". We should learn from it and do things cautiously, step by step.

  People have views whatsoever on job-hopping. When we go any length to do something, We care for not only the speed but also the quality. In some sense, the latter is of more importance to us. If we pursue the high speed when we do some work, we may be ignorant of the quality. However, the quality is the very thing we are after. Cite an example. In 1980's, most of the developing countries were after the high speed of economic growth in order to exceed the developed countries. They made many economics [wd2,-1] policys [fm1,-] referring to [wd3,1-] how to improve the speed of economic growth. Because they neglected the quality of economic growth or economic development, they had a poor harvest. 1980's was called the lose decade of developing countries. Some developed countries which shown [vp4,s-] more importance on the quality of economic growth made progress. In a word, we'd better pay attention to both speed and quality, voiding [fm1,-] the waste taken place in the pursuit of speed. [sn8,s-]

<ST 4> <SEX ?> <Y ?> <AGE ?> <DIC ?> <TYP 1> <WAY 1>  <TITLE Haste Makes Waste>  <SCH 2207> <SCORE 7> <ID 430115> 


  "Haste makes waste" is an old saying of our country. It contains two meanings.One is that if you want to succeed, you should firstly be patient. The other is if you are too impatient, your goal will otherwise difficult to reach.[sn8,s] The reason of "haste makes waste"[np1,-]is that only hard work lead [vp3,1-] to success and to complete a hard work needs a long time. [sn8,s-] You may want to be a teacher in your childhood. Certainly you couldn't turn your dream into practice [wd3,3-] in one night. You must learn Arithmetic [wd3,1-], Chinese, physics and other basic course [np3,2-] in your primary school, and high school. Then after years of above mentioned knowledge's study you will learn how to make a student learn fastly [fm2,-] and well in the Normal university. [sn8,s-] Then after your [wd2,1-1] graduated [vp6,-s] from the Normal university, you really become a teacher. You will see how it is to reach a goal, to catch a success [cc3,2-]. Contrastly [fm2,-], if you raise a purpose [cc3,2-] today to be teacher, and you want to teach in the classroom tomorrow. [sn2,s] Can't you imagine how you will teach and how much the students will know you? "Where there is a will, there is a success". This is another Chinese old saying, work hard and patiently, you will get your purpose in the end.[sn1,s]


<ST 4> <SEX ?> <Y ?> <AGE ?> <DIC ?> <TYP 1> <WAY 1>  <TITLE Haste Makes Waste>  <SCH 2207> <SCORE 7> <ID 441019>


  You may usually hear people say "haste makes waste", however, do you know what it mean.[sn1,s] Sometimes, people must do something in very short time. So they want [vp1,-1] do very fast. But they often forget some essential procedures. When they remind [wd3,s-], they have to do it again. So they finish it more later [aj3,1-] than normal or finish it imperfectly. For example, you hurry to catch on the train. When you reach the station, you find [vp1,-s] leave off the ticket on the table. [sn8,s-] After you return for the ticket and arrive again, the train has gone off. You want to hurry. But inversly [fm1,-], you miss the train.

Otherwise you will not succeed. Because "Haste [fm3,-] Makes [fm3,-] Waste [fm3,-]" [sn2,s]


<ST 4> <SEX ?> <Y ?> <AGE ?> <DIC ?> <TYP 1> <WAY 1> <TITLE Haste Makes Waste>  <SCH 2207> <SCORE 9> <ID 440713>


  Every person knows that time is invaluable, so some people are always in a hurry. But, [sn9,s-] on the other hand, every one must know  haste makes waste. When you do things in a hurry, you will find that time is always not enough. When the rate of success is low, because you will forget many facts of act, or take something by mistake. [sn2,s] For an example, you are having a test, and you want to finish the test ahead of time. So you have to write quickly. At the same time you will find your handwriting is very poor.   Why do we say "Haste makes waste"?  because [fm3,-] every thing has its own content [wd3,s-]. [sn2,s] We should operate it according to its steps. [sn2,s] First, you should be able to read so and so, and then, you ought to learn words, based on which, you will understand a long report written with English. <ST 4> <SEX ?> <Y ?> <AGE ?> <DIC ?> <TYP 1> <WAY 1> <TITLE Haste Makes Waste>  <SCH 2207> <SCORE 9> <ID 430107>


  Chinese often say: [sn9,s-]?haste makes waste?. If you determine to do something well, you should do it step by step. In case you want to get the purpose of it [pr1,s-] much faster, then you will not work hard but want [vp1,-1] get it at once. Finally, you'll not succeed in doing it. For example, five years ago my classmates and I decided to climb the mountain near our school. Firstly, I said to classmates [np6,1-]:?If we run to it, and we can get there at 10:00?. Then we all ran fast, but soon we tired.[sn8,s] And when we got there, it was 2:00 P.M. Another time, I determined to pass Maths [fm2,-] exam two years ago, especialy [fm1,-] I wanted to got [vp5,2-3] a high score. So I thought some of the questions could not ask. [sn8,s-] If I wrote down the questions I thought it had, I could get to pass it and get a high score. But, finally, I had only a score of 65 in the exam. In a word, you should not do anything faster than you can. You should do everything step by step.

  In Chinese, there is an idiom-haste makes waste. Every one of us expect [vp3,4-] to do a thing both well and quickly. But it is too difficulty to realize. <ST 4> <SEX ?> <Y ?> <DIC ?> <WAY 1> <SCH 2705> <TITLE Health Gains in Developing Countries> <SCORE 8> <ID 430511> 
In recent decades, life expectancy and infant mortality have great [wd2,1-1] changed in developing countries.
Life expectancy has great [wd2,1-1] increased, on the contrary, infant mortality has great [wd2,1-1] decreased.[sn1,s-] For instance, life expectancy was forty years old in 1960, nevertheless, was sixty years old in 1990, its range was from fifty to sixty.[sn1,s-] It has increased [cc3,-5] one-third of the primitive figure. Infant mortality was 200 deaths per 1000 births in 1960, but, [wd4,s-] was 100 deaths per 1000 births in 1990. Its range was from 200 to 100. It has decreased in half [wd7,1-].
They were caused by several reasons. First, economy increased [cc2,1-] in developing countries. It caused the improvement of the level [wd3,-2] of life and the change of the structure of food. Second, medical career [wd3,s-] make [vp3,2-] great progress and so forth.

<ST 4> <SEX ?> <Y ?> <AGE ?> <DIC ?> <TYP 1> <WAY 1> <SCH 2841> <TITLE Global Shortage of Fresh Water> <SCORE 10> <ID 448129> 
People take it for granted that fresh water is unlimited, we can get [cc3,-6] no matter how much we want.[sn1,s-] It isn't strange that people think so, because they think the resource of fresh water is rich, we also can obtain it in many ways [wd4,s-] rain, river, well and so on.[sn1,s-]
In fact, shortage of fresh water [cc2,s-] is very serious. There are several reasons for this. First of all, the population in the world increases rapidly. Human beings demand more and more from the globe, especially the water, which is essential to life. Secondly, every country tries its best to develop its industry as quickly as possible. So more water is needed. Besides, people keep water polluting [wd1,3-]. In a word, global shortage of fresh water is one of the most serious problems [cc2,s-]facing us today.
I think people should take some steps to solve this problem, of course, firstly we should protect fresh water resouce [fm1,-] from polluting [vp7,s-]. Then we have two ways [np1, 2-]: one is to reuse water, the other is to change sea water into fresh water. Researchers have made progress [np6,2-] in this field. I hope in [pp2, -1]future fresh water [cc2,s-] will not be short any more.


<ST 4> <SEX ?> <Y ?> <AGE ?> <DIC ?> <TYP 1> <WAY 1> <SCH 2841> <TITLE Global Shortage of Fresh Water> <SCORE 6> <ID 445512> 
People always take it for granted that fresh water is much [cc6, -1] 
enough for us to use. In their opinion, we can get fresh water from rain, river, lake, under the ground etc.
But in fact, we are very short of fresh water. We can understand it from the following conditions [wd3,s-]. First, with the increase of populations, people's need and use of fresh water has risen quickly. Second with the dvelopment [fm1,-] of industry, the amount of fresh water used in industry is becoming larger and larger. Finally, water pollution becomes much more serious than ever. From this, we can see the global shortage of fresh water.
What shall we do [wd3,s-] with this? Firstly, we should settle the problem of water pollution. "Haste makes waste" is an old saying of China. Often [ad1,-3] people want to finish something more quickly, but often [ad1,-3] they can not do it well. Thus, the things he (she) has done is in bad quanlity [fm1,-], even nothing good can be found in the things.[sn1,s-] That is, he (she) wastes time doing everything for he (she) seeks for haste. In our life, such example can be found easily. For example, during our country's construction, if we ignore all things around her and are eager to make our country develop more quickly and can't do it step by step, we will not succeed. Many things have proved it. So we can conclude that we mustn't seek for haste only but carry out everything step by step when we are doing them, otherwise we won't do everything well.

<ST 4> <SEX ?> <Y ?> <AGE ?> <DIC ?> <TYP 1> <WAY 1> <SCH 2501> <TITLE Haste Makes Waste > <SCORE 11> <ID 445219> 
Wanting to do something quickly but make [vp4,s-] a mess in the end, that is what calls "Haste makes waste". [sn8,s-] Why does haste make waste? It is very easy to understand it. When a man is so eagerly [wd2,2-1] to finish something in a hurry, what loads [wd3,1-2] his mind might be "quick, quick and quick"; then he will forget to think over every aspects of the whole situation comprehesively [fm1,-], he will forget to make preparations necessary [wd1,2-].[sn1,s-] To make it even worse, because he is in such a hurry that careliness [fm1,-] and patience needed in doing the work are rare. Then, the only consequense [fm1,-] will be a mess.
An old Chinese story has the meaning of "haste makes waste." Once a father told his two sons to cut down some branches and gave them each a steeny [fm1,-] knife. The first one took the knife immediately onto [wd3,s-] the forest in order to be back sooner than the other. But the second one took a look at the knife first, then trid [fm1,-] to make it sharp despite his brother's going working earlier. [wd4,-3] The afternoon, the second one went home with many branches, but the first one came home very late and had little [np8,-1] branches, and said, "the knife isn't sharp completely [wd3,2-]. I'm sorry." That is what the old saying says: "To make the knife sharp at first will gain much time." [wd7,s-]
So, when you want to do something well, you must not haste [wd2,s-] but make sure everything have [vp3,1-] been prepared.

One of the old sayings says: "Haste makes waste." There are two reasons for it. First, things must be done step by step. If you're in a hurry, you'll probably skip some step which seems unimportant but are actually essential. Second, If [fm3,-] you want to finish doing something quickly, you must be too nervous to work properly. As a result, you will fail eventually when you ignore some necessary steps or do something wrong.
Almost everyone has such experience. For example, A housewife will often forget to light a fire before cooking when she wants to prepare a meal in a short time. Or she will probably add some sugar into the dishes instead of salt. When these things happen, She [fm3,-] must do it again. That's called "Haste makes waste."


<ST 4> <SEX ?> <Y ?> <AGE ?> <DIC ?> <TYP 1> <WAY 1> <SCH 2501> <TITLE Haste Makes Waste> <SCORE 9> <ID 445617> 
Why does haste make waste? There are several reasons. First, we always need some indispensible [fm1,-] preparations before we manage to finish a task. It seems that these work [np3,1-] are unnecessary, but they are often essential for the success in the future. On the other side, If [fm3,-] we want to reach our goal, we must follow the right instruction properly. That is, we must carry out the procedure step by step. Sometime [wd3,s-], even if you omit a minor step, the whole thing will fail and you have to start all over again from the very beginning. In fact, it is a waste of time to finish work in a hurry and come out with [wd3,2-4] a bad outcome. I remember that once I wanted to finish an experiment ahead of time so that I could attend a party on time. I omitted some steps which I considered "not important". The result turned out to be a bad one. I made a mess of my experiment and had to do it once more. At the same time, I missed the party.
So, we can draw a conclusion that haste can cause failure and fault. If we want to save our time, then, don't do things in a hurry. Follow the right way and you can get the best results.

<ST 4> <SEX ?> <Y ?> <AGE ?> <DIC ?> <TYP 1> <WAY 1> <SCH 2501> <TITLE Haste akes Waste> <SCORE 8> <ID 445615> 
"Haste makes Waste [fm3,-]" is a common idiom. But why? Because when you are in a hurry, you may do without consideration, and you are likely to act against the principles. When you act against the principles, then [wd5,s-], what you do can only bring you the opposit [fm1,-] result.
Although this idiom is known widely, people tend to haste [wd2,s-] spontaneously or unconsciously. For example, in the ancient China, a farmer was anxious with his crops. Why don't they grow faster, in such a sunny day? I should work out a method to help them, he thought. But how? At last, he got an idea. Then he went to the field, pulled the crops to a satisfactory height, and returned home to wait for the harvest. And you can imagine what he ended up in at last.
This story is famous almost all over China. It may warn us that haste makes waste when we tend to do something without caution.

Haste makes waste, is an old Chinese saying. It means if you hurry to do something, you will often fail to get to the desired goal.
The reason [cc2,s-] may be the following two points. First, when you are in a hurry, you can't get every thing ready before you begin the job. So you'll find something necessary has been forgotten when you are doing the job. And you have to return to the beginning. Second, if you are [wd4,-1] hurry, you must be impatient. When you met with something unexpected, you won't deal with it with a patient heart. And the difficulty will often can't [vp9,2-] be solved.
There are many examples that can prove the saying. The following is a simple one. A boy was afraid of going to school late so he did every thing in a hurry. When he get [vp3,s-] to school, he found he had forgotten to take the homework which will be handed on [wd3,1-]. So he had to return home to get the homework. Because he was too hurry [wd2,s-] to get the homework, he was late at last.
The saying tells us that before you want to do something successful [wd2,2-], you won't [wd3,s-] do it in a hurry. It's better for you to think it over before you do it.

I understood the meaning in an unforgettable way. It was a high school English exam. The reading comprehension was very difficult because of many new words. <ST 4> <SEX ?> <Y ?> <AGE ?> <DIC ?> <WAY ?> <TYP 1> <SCH 2501> <TITLE Haste Makes Waste> <SCORE 11> <ID 446302> 
There is a famous Chinese saying "Haste makes waste." Some people are always trying to do things in a hasty way in order to save time. But in fact, they often have to spend more time. Why is [wd4,s-] the case?
Firstly, those people set out doing things without a plan. Thus they don't know what important task should be finished at the beginning. Secondly, they are anxious to save time, without a plan, so they can't get along step by step. Furthermore, the result of their work won't be fine in such a hasty way.
Most things we do in our daily life proves [vp3,s-] the saying right. For instance, when the Chinese teacher asks students to write a composition, many students begin writing without a plan. Obviously, those students want to write an article quickly. But without a well organized constructure [fm2,-], the students especially beginners aren't able to write a precise, coherent composition. If they make out a plan beforehand, they can have a clear thought. After they start to write they are able to finish the composition quickly.
So remember "Haste Makes [fm3,1-1] Waste." Start with a good schedule.

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Charm>    Charm is one complicated feeling you get from another person. You would like  to contact with a charming human, even you love him(her) and want to make  friends with him(her). In daily life there are so many persons you have to face, and  you could be aware of the difference of charm among them. Though charm is one  real feeling that everyone knows, it's hard to tell why one person is charming but  another not. So I want to set an example which is helpful to discover the causation.    In my living environment, my most charming person is my tutor. Before I  became his student, I knew little of him and just heard that he was a famous  economist. At that time tutor was just an abstract existence and my feeling to [pp1,-] him was neutral. Keeping contact with my tutor for one year, [sn3,-] he has been more and more charming to me. I like him so much that I would like to work for him without  any payment. Of course not only myself but also many other persons including  many local and central leaders think he is charming.    Then I ask myself why my tutor is charming? Because of his being handsome, or  his great academic achievement? I think these are not main reasons, in fact his most  attracting [cc4,-] feature is his noble spirit. [sn1,-] He works hard for people' life and the national development. He engages himself to seek a powerful road of China at the expense of his health and family happiness. Besides, another important reason is that he is kind to persons especially his students.     From the experience from [pp1,-] my tutor, I conclude that charm comes from a person's  characters which could be divided into external characters and inherent characters.  External characters such as pretty appearance and repute could bring on charm,  many young fellow admire famous singers and film stars who are usually pretty or  handsome.[sn1,-]  But those are not the most important reasons, in fact, the charm from external characters could not last a long time. [sn1,-] The real and most important reason of charm comes from inherent characters such as temperament, ability, spirit.  Napoleon was ugly, but he had marvelous talent and strong volition, and he was so  charming that many people adore him two hundred years later after his death..[sn9,-] On the contrast, if a man has handsome appearance, but he is ugly, short of  perseverance and useless to society, then would you think he has charm?      One person should not complain his being absent of charm because his parents  haven't given him handsome face and graceful stature. Since charm comes from  inherent characters, you could get charm through your efforts. Cultivate your  temperament [cc3,-], train your ability [cc3,-] and educate your mind [cc3,-] day after day, then you would become more and more charming. [sn1,-]  My dormitory  I live in a very small dormitory, Room 604 in Building 26. It is only about 10  centimeters, crowded with three double beds, one bookcase, one desk and three  students including me. 	Our dormitory is not only a small one but also a disordered one. Once you  burst through [vp2,-] the door (we often forget to lock it up) and came into the room, you will not consider the room as a student's dormitory. [vp6,-] This is because you can not find anything formal. The three beds seems [vp3,-] widely divergent [wd3,-]: The first bed you will see on the left hand is covered with a gray and dusty mosquito-curtain [fm2,-] throughout the year, which [pr1,-] is so opaque that nobody can dope out whether or not there is any people in it. On the right hand, the bed is quite different from the first one, it is too neat and clear to be impressive. [sn1,-] Behind the first bed, the bed close to the window is mine. [sn8,-] My bed is always filled with a lot of books like rubbish, I can't deal with them, so I have never been living in my bed for several mouths [fm1,-]. [sn1,-]  	My dormitory I live in a very small dormitory, Room 604 in Building 26. It is only about 10  centimeters, crowded with three double beds, one bookcase, one desk and three  students including me. 	Our dormitory is not only a small one but also a disordered one. Once you  burst through the door (we often forget to lock it up) and came into the room, you  will not consider the room as a student's dormitory. This is because you can not  find anything formal. The three beds seems widely divergent: The first bed you will  see on the left hand is covered with a gray and dusty mosquito-curtain throughout  the year, which is so opaque that nobody can dope out whether or not there is any  people in it. On the right hand, the bed is quite different from the first one, it is too neat and clear to be impressive. Behind the first bed, the bed close to the window is mine. My bed is always filled with a lot of books like rubbish, I can't deal with them, so I have never been living in my bed for several mouths.  	A another reason [np9,-] for my dislike of my dormitory is that there is a leak in the roof, the rain will come in from it. [sn1,-] To my surprise, the building was built only few [np8,-] years ago! 	Our dormitory is not perfect, but compared with the ones of the  undergraduate's,  it is luxury. I have no right to complain about it, after all, the  number of Tsinghua students is too large.  
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Democracy>  There are few words which are used frequently than the word "Democracy" on  the world political stage. What does it mean? It means literally rule [np5,-] by the people (from the Greek demos, "people", and kratos, "rule" ). It means that tyranny, the hotbed of warfare, give [vp3,-] place to parliaments where laws are made, independent  courts of justice in which over long periods those laws are maintained, and  dependable governments in which people's rights are ensured. That is Democracy--and in its soil grow continually freedom, comfort and culture. When Democracy reigns in any country, a wider and civilized life is afforded to the masses of the people. The central principle of Democracy is the subordination of the ruling authority  to the settled customs of the people and to their will as expressed through the  Constitution.  There are three ways to show Democracy. At first, a form of government or  other authoritative office in which the right to make political decisions is exercised  directly by the whole body of citizens, known as direct Democracy. Secondly, a  form of government or other authoritative office in which the citizens exercise the  same right not in person but through representatives chosen by and responsible to  them, known as representative Democracy. Finally, a form of government or other  authoritative office in which the power of the majority exercised [vp7,-] within a  framework of constitutional restraints designed to guarantee [vp2,-] all citizens the rights  such as freedom of speech, religion, body, etc, known as liberal Democracy. In our country we have today achieved in a high degree the blessings of  Democracy, there is freedom; there is law; there is a widening prosperity.[sn1,-]  
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Classification of Human Beings>  Broadly speaking, all human beings can be divided into three classes, although  everyone is unique. They are, namely, utilitarian, ethical and aesthetic person [np6,-].  The first kind of people includes both materialist and most of the politicians. They  always stick firmly to money or potency and may do every thing in order to get  them [pr1,-]. So one can say they do not have any failure in their life. Because of this they are shortsighted and not likely to make great achievements in their life. They rarely have any trusty friend and they are not loyal even to their best friends. Compared with them, people belonging to the second class are most suitable to be one's  friends. They are always faithful to whatever they think they should do according  to the morality, no matter how meaningless they are essentially. They may harm  someone from prejudice. Sometimes they may even do something greatly harmful  to the society because of their prejudice. While the third kind of people think  nothing is worthy for them to be faithful all their lives. They are prone to accept  new things in the world. Though are called aesthetic people [sn3,-], always seeking the meaning of everything, they feel sad and lonely in most of their life.  It is useful for a person to know which class he belong [vp3,-] to in order to live happily together.                                               
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title My most admiring person>   He was an ordinary-looking person, thin but high. Though I have not seen him  for many years, I always miss him. He was my middle-school English teacher-Mr  Zhang, my most admiring person.   Mr Zhang was very responsible and always spent a long time preparing his class,  so his class was interesting and impressive. He carefully reviewed our assignments  and marked mistakes in them. As to our puzzles, he patiently explained them till  we understood. Therefore, we all love him and his class.   Furthermore, Mr Zhang gave special attention and support to those who didn't do  well in English. I also benefited from his kindness. At first, my English was very  poor and had difficulty keeping up with other students [sn8,-]. Gradually,I lost confidence and regarded English study as my insurmountable obstacle. When Mr Zhang knew what happened to me,he held a private talk with me. He told me that I would  overcome difficulty if I could be patient and work hard. Moreover, he arranged  some students who had a good mastery of English to help me with my English.  Finally, I made a great progress in English study and could get high score in  English examinations.   Above all, Mr Zhang set a good example for me that everyone should be  Commited [fm1,-] to his work and care for others.    
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title CLASSIFICATION>  Factors Responsible for the Burgeoning Air Pollution Problem While air pollution is not a new phenomenon, it is now apparent that it is one of  our most rapidly growing environmental problems. There are three major  underlying factors, which serve to explain this condition.  The first factor is population growth. More people mean more manufactured goods  and services. [More people implies [vp3,-] that more goods and services are required.] This, in turn, lends to the second factor. The second one is expansion in industry and technology. The growth of industrial  activity, in the same period, has likewise been remarkable in terms of expansion [wd4,-] of existing plant capacity, and the increase in number of new manufacturing  establishments. The nature of the airborne wastes from some of these new  technology was completely unknown until adverse effects on man and his  environment suddenly became manifest. The third one is social changes. Two  important social changes including urbanization and the rising standard of living  occurred during this same period, and served to accelerate the trend of burgeoning  air pollution. Total [wd5,-] in a word, the combined impact of population growth, expansion in industry and technology and social changes operating in our contemporary society can be regarded as the compounding factors which have resulted in serious degradation of the urban air environment within relatively recent years. [sn7,-] He worked hard and became  excellence [wd2,-] in his study. When he was a grade three senior student, he did  so well that all the teachers thought he was doomed to go to the college.  Just then the "Chinese Cultural Revolution" broke out, which concealed the  entrance examination and dashed father's hope for college to the ground.  After several years of heavy labor work in the country, he heard the  information that the examination would resume soon when I have been  born [vp6,-]. As the only adult man in my family, he gave up this opportunity at last  due to the living pressure. He decided to support the family by farming, but  he also tried his best to find time reading and thinking. In 1980's, he passed  the exam for a machine plant and became a worker. He is conscientious  and has made a good job of designing mechanic equipments. After he had  served the enterprise about twenty years and when he was fifty-two, the  plant broke out. Being in depression for a short period, father decided to  establish a private firm instead of waiting for aftercare. Father is an honest and faithful person. He is warm-hearted to his friends  and workmates, and always ready to help them. Many people would still  remember he spent his spare time to help the new workers learning [vp5,-]  techniques without any charge. Father is strict with us children [wd5,-]. He always tells us: "Don't trust the fate,  but make efforts to control it! "What we try to give  you is how to be a righteous and useful person, while some other parents  try to leave lots of money for their children." Father said [vp6,-] to me and my  sister.  
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Letter, e-mail and telephone> Letter, e-mail and telephone are the most three [wd1,-] wide [wd2,-] used ways for people in different places to communicate [vp1,-] each other. They share many abilities [wd3,-]. However, the characteristics of them are much different. Writing letters is the most traditional and formal way. Usually people can mail  some papers in words and/or pictures in a letter. Because letters are delivered by  post offices, it will take several days for a letter to reach its destination. Another  weakness of letters is that it is rather expensive especially for overseas ones. Sending e-mails to contact is the result of the developing of the digital  technology. Because e-mails are sent through Internet, Sending  e-mails is a very  fast, cheap and safe communication way. Thousands of e-mails can be delivered in  several minutes safely with very low cost. What is more, all digital medium,  including words, pictures and even sounds all can be sent by e-mails, and those  make e-mails much vivid and interesting. Because the great superiority of the  e-mail, it becomes the most popular communication way in the university students  now. Taking telephones is a real time way. The great strength of telephones is it is interactive, so people in different places can chatter through them. Visual  telephones even can help people see each other. The weakness of telephones is also  obvious. Only sound can be sent by this way. What is more, the cost of it is very  high. In my option, e-mail is the tread of the developing of communication way. It will be used widely in our daily life.  How to built [fm1,-] up Computer With the economic development in our country, more and more  Computer [np6,-] is [vp3,-] coming into usual family [np6,-]. In  this way, it is very convenient, but you loss [wd2,-] the opportunity to enjoy from [vp1,-] building up a computer and you may cost [wd3,-] more money sometimes. I suggest  you to build up your own computer. Now, I give you a hand about how to build  up a computer. In general, the four steps [np7,-] may be necessary. First, define [vp4,-] basic parameter of the computer, which depend [vp3,-] on what do  you do with your computer [sn8,-]. For example, if it is only applied on typing word and going into Internet, Pentium II is enough; if you want to process images frequently, perhaps Pentium III with 128M RAM is better. By the way, better specification means costing more money. Second, to select and buy every part of the computer. The hardware  includes monitor, keyboard, main board with CPU, modem, mouse, hard-disk  and its driver, CD-driver, soft-disk driver, RAM, sound box and its driver. The  software includes system software and applied software.  Third, to build up the hardware of the computer. It is very easy because  every part and its interface are standard. Your task is to put every element  together according to their relationship.  The last step, which is the most important and difficult step, is to load in  software and to test the whole system. Specialized knowledge is needed to test  the addresses of every port of the system, avoiding complicate [vp5,-] with each other.  Till now, a whole computer system has been built up. <ST 4>  <band 6> <title Cars> Considered the usage, Cars can be categorized into two kinds. The most familiar to us is those cars that used [vp7,-] for transportation. <ST 4>  <band 6> <title Computer> According to the scale and performance, computers can be classified as  huge-scaled computers, middle-scaled computers or personal computers. A huge-scaled computer is also called a massive parallel processor. In general,  it is composed of several dozens of central processing units with great processing  speed, huge capacity of memory and hard disk [np6,-]. It can provide good performance to satisfy the need of complicated transaction processing such as weather forecasting.  Of course, it is very expensive (usually more than $100,000). On the other hand, a  personal computer usually has only one common central processing unit, one or  several memory cards and hard disks. It can meet the requirement in our daily  works, and its price is usually about $1,000. A middle-scaled computer just stands  between the huge-scaled computer and personal computer in scale, performance  and price. It usually contains several central processing units, memory cards and  hard disks. It usually costs from $10,000 to $100,000. And it can be used in  enterprise business management.

Usually individuals talk about whether they believe  in someone or not, or whether they are confident with something or not. In fact,  they are talking about the meaning of trust. Trust means the assured reliance on  some person [np6,-] or something. That is also to say,  trust is a feeling that people have a confident dependence on the character, ability, strength or truth of someone or something. We make friends or pursue good qualities of things in our ordinary life. The purpose is that we can trust in them anytime in order to promote the quality of our life. <ST 4>  <band 6> <title Type of speech>     As we all know, the same meaning can be described In [fm3,-] different words  according to different situations. Almost all examples of speech by most speakers  of English fall into three categories: "standard", "colloquial" and "slang".    In general, standard usage includes those words and expressions understood,  used, and accepted by a majority of the speakers of a language in formal situations;  colloquialisms, on the other hand, are familiar words and idioms that are  understand [vp4,-] by almost all of [wd4,-] speakers  of a language and used in informal speech or writing, almost all idiomatic expressions are colloquial language; [sn1,-] Slang, however, refers to words and expressions understood by a large number of speakers but not accepted as good, formal usage by the majority.    It is necessary to point out that colloquial and slang speech often passes [vp3,-] into standard speech, but both colloquial usage and slang are more common in speech  than in writing. Most speakers of English will, during [pp2,-] appropriate situations, select and use all three types of expressions.     Miss Yang, for me, is a new teacher, because I am a new student of hers. <ST 4>  <band 6> <title HOW TO MAKE JIAOZI>  Material:  flour, meat, cabbage, salt, spring onion. Procedure:  1.	Chop up meat into mince, and mix it with chopped cabbage and  spring onions  to make stuffing. 2.	Mix up flour with adequate water to form a large lump of dough. 3.	Cut the large lump of dough into small lumps. 4.	Roll the lumps of dough into round wrappers with a rolling pin. The radius and  thickness of each wrapper is 3-4 inches and 0.05-0.1 inch respectively. 5.	Put a lump of stuffing on a piece of wrapper, then wrap the lump of mince  tightly to make a jiaozi. Repeat this procedure till stuffing or wrappers run out. 6.	Put these jiaozi into a pot of boiling water, then put on the lid and  wait until  jiaozi float on water; ready to serve!  
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Charm>  	A football match between JiNan and GuangZhou was going on. JiNan gained  the lead by 2-0 in thirty minutes. But GuangZhou won by three goals to two at last.  By and large, the audience feeled [fm1,-] the charm of football once more, while the fans of JiNan had different feelings. They might feel sad, depressed, angry, and so on. 	There are a lot of things that have their own charm, such as football, chess (and  other sports), beautiful scenery, lovely boys or girls. The common point is that all  these things can give us pleasure. In the above example [np6,-], the fans of JiNan might not feel "the charm of football", because they were not pleased. 	Charm is the power to give pleasure. There are various reasons why things can  give pleasure. They may be unpredictable, exciting, interesting, smart or beautiful.  
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title The Street of the Third Month of the Lunar Year> I. Time    From 15th to 20 th in the third month of the lunar year II. Locale     At the foot of the Cengshan Mountain in the west of Dali III. Celebrations     A. Put up thousands of stalls and decoreted [fm1,-] archways on the level ground     B. Exchange native products     C. Perform Dian Opera, Bai Drama and Fesitive [fm1,-] Lantern     D. Race Horse     E. Choose lovers IV. History    A. Has [vp4,-] a history of thousands of years    B. First was names as 'The street of the Buddist Goddess of Mercy' [sn8,-] VI. Summary             The street of the third month of the lunar year is a traditional festival of  the Dali Bai Autonomous Prefecture. From 15th to 20th in the third month of the  lunar year, the festival is held at the foot of the Cengshan Mountain in the west  of Dali.   During the course of the festival, thousands of stalls and decorated archways  are put up on the level groud [fm1,-], dividing the level ground into several streets.  Colorful flags swaying by the stroke of the breeze, crowd of [np2,-] sellers are exchanging the adundant [fm1,-] native products along the street. Elegant performance of Dian Opera and Bai Drama can be seen everywhere. The most exciting activity is the Horse Race, which can attracted [vp9,-] thousands of audience. On the race arena, girls are looking for their lovers secretly.   The festival has a history of more than one thousand year [np6,-]. At first, it was called 'The Street of Buddist Goddess of Mercy'. Gradually, it developed into  a large products exchanging festival. Famous for its goods exchanging, art  performance and horse race, the festival is the largest festival in the west of  the Tunnan Province now. [sn2,-]

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title The smile>   Last winter vacation, we went to Hunan province to teach in a primary  school.   When I sat at the back of the classroom to listen to the master's speech,  I found that sitting beside me was a small boy dressed almost in rags. He  had got a dusty face, [wd4,-] a head of messy hair. He kept behaving very strangely.  He didn't listen to the master; instead, he was busy drawing something, as  I think he was drawing, in his exercise book. But he would immediately  scratch on it, [sn9,-] tear it up after he had finished drawing [sn1,-]. I joked with him," Why are your hands so dirty?" Even though others laughed at him, he  didn't answer me; he didn't show any expression on his face, just scratch [vp4,-],  and scratch [vp4,-].   After class, he was left alone in his seat, I approached him,  before we could talk, another boy came up to and said to me  loudly," Mr. Zhao, he is a halfwit." [sn1,-] Every child present burst into  violent laughter, While he didn't even open his mouth, [sn9,-] he didn't cry, [sn9,-]  he didn't lift his eyes. [sn1,-] The silent answer to such personal insult  made me wonder what it was that made him such an odd boy.   I asked his teacher and knew more about him. He was an orphan, living  with his two retired grandparents. He was suffering from both poverty and  loneliness.   I decided to do something. When I taught them to sing an English song,  I would stand near to him to let him hear and follow me more easily. After  that class, I waited outside the classroom, and went back together with him.  I tried to talk with him, and finally asked," can I visit your home?" He  thought for a while and said," I am too shy to invite guests."   "Go back and talk to your grandparents, [sn9,-] tell me whether they agree or  not this afternoon, [sn1,-] O.K.?" He nodded.   He said all right that afternoon.   At 19:30, he came to pick me up right on time. I had a good talk with  his family members, and inspired him as possible as I could. During the  talk, I could feel that his grandparents were both looking forward to his  great future. And I felt that I was coming nearer and nearer to the real him  ever since.   On the last day of our staying there, we were talking freely in the 3rd  floor corridor. He came up to me, reached his hands into his pocket, took  out an orange and said," Here you are, I grew it in my field." And then, he  took out another two and handed to me," you can share with your friends."   Just then, I saw one of my friends talking with his pupils down in the  playground. I said to him," Why not throw one to him?" He picked up an  orange, [sn9,-] threw down. [sn1,-]   He was such a bad thrower that before the orange could reach that far, it  hit the ground heavily, split [vp5,-], and splashed [vp5,-]. He suddenly burst into laughter, so happily, so heartily, [sn1,-] that tears almost came to my eyes." He laughed, he laughed." I kept talking to myself.   The memory of other experiences there faded as time passed. But the  two oranges, the real, real, happy laughter I've ever heard did leave deep  impressions in my mind, whenever I recall them, they are as fresh as  happened yesterday. [sn1,-]    
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title A real friend of mine>   She was my classmate when I was in junior middle school. In my impression, she  was a pretty little girl who sat quietly behind me. But we were by no means friends  at that time because we had never talked with each other. That sounded incredible-  perhaps I was too shy a little boy [np9,-] then. Her family moved to Shanghai when we were in junior three. She gave me a small card before she left. I accepted it  indifferently and soon forgot about it.   One year later, I went to live in the same city with her. I didn't realize that until one day I happened to meet her in the street. Of course, both of us were very  surprised to see each other. Naturally, we had our first conversation, which lasted  only a few minutes. We even didn't ask about each other's address before we walked  back on our each own journey and lost touch again.   What really surprised me was the card I received [wd4,-] that year's Christmas. It was a cold winter day when I just went back from class. A large white envelope was lying quietly on my desk. My name was written in a graceful but strange handwriting [np5,-].  With surprise and puzzlement, I opened it and saw a small red card with her name  at the bottom- it was SHE who sent it. She said she had asked several people for my  address and finally got it. She wanted to let me know that she was so glad to have  such a friend as me in this city?-"a friend"? I knew I had forgotten all about her  since that meeting, taking for granted it was just a coincidence. But she hadn't, and she even managed to send the card, regarding me as one of her friends. Moved and  ashamed, I read her words times again, knowing what a fool I was. I never thought  I understood exactly what friendship meant to me. At that time, however, I realized  friendship could be like this- a card with the warmest wishes, which was making  the winter days soft and gentle.   The next morning, I put into the postbox a delicate card, with my apology and my  sincere wishes for her- a real friend of mine.

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Chingming Festival> A.	April 4th or 5th B.	To memorize the forebears C.	Activities of the entire family 1.	Repairing the forebears' rest places a.	Graves swept b.	Flowers placed c.	Offerings of meat ,vegetables or dinner arranged d.	Paper money burned      2. Bowing to express respect  Paragraph    Chingming festival is held annually on April 4th or 5th. It is a Chinese memorial day--a time of sentimental remembrance of the forebears. Usually the entire family take the day to visit the resting place of the forebears of the family. First, they repair the place, which has been left alone for a year. Graves are swept, manicured, fresh flowers placed, and perhaps a few new bushes or trees are planted. [sn1,-] Offerings of meats, vegetables, wine, and often a complete dinner are arranged and placed in front of the tombs. Other offerings of paper money and other symbols of wealth are burned in the belief that it [pr1,-] will transform into real wealth for their  ancestors in the spiritual world. Then, members of the family will bow to express their respect and transmit their regards. Usually, the eldest begins this portion of the rite by reading a prayer, which is subsequently burned amidst the explosion of firecrackers. Thus, the spirits of the ancestors are soothed. Their devoted offsprings [np5,-] have not neglected or forgotten them.                                                                  
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title TRUST MUSTN'T BE TRAMPLED> After a spell of extremely hard work and preparation, the first simulative [fm2,-] National Entrance Examination was coming. As senior middle school students, we all put a great Emphasis [np5,-] on this test. Because if you did well this time, it meant a very good start of a series of cruel exams [cc4,-] and you would have psychological advantage [np6,-] in the final NEE. In the exam, I was assigned to sit beside Peter. He looked nervous and anxious. A glance at him put me also on the edge [wd7,-].  But I hold the rein of [np2,-] my mind tightly and finished the paper when there were still twenty minutes to go [wd3,-]. I checked it over twice and found no mistakes. A deep breath got me calm, and everything ended for me. I took [wd3,-] my time to look at the classmates around leisurely. Suddenly, a whistle came into my ears, it was Peter's voice, "The key to the last question, please." [sn1,-] I turned around and saw his eyes full of pleas. Just before the  examination, Peter had a long talk with me. He asked me to "help" him in the test and gave me his word that it would be a secret of us forever. There were no much time before the NEE, and I thought the best way to increase his marks was not to find his faults in the knowledge but to establish a solid self-confidence [np5,-]. Therefore, high marks were more necessary. So I agreed. Now, as he turned to me, I gave him what he wanted generously. My cheating skill was perfect and it succeeded. Everything seemingly went on well. Peter got his high marks after a week. No one knew the secret until two days after the results of the test were announced. I had an ominous hunch when someone told me that I was wanted by the dean. I went into the office worriedly. As expected, the dean had some doubts about Peter's marks. He asked me, of course, in some other indirect ways if I had "helped" him. "Tell me the truth, I trust you." he added in the end. I denied peremptorily. It was a secret, and I could not fail [wd3,-] Peter. "OK, I trust you." The dean said again and let me go. After a few minutes, Peter was called. I told him the reason of the summons in time and asked him not to let the secret out. "I trust you." I said. A long time  later, Peter came back. I knew what happened from the expression of his face, guilty [wd2,-]. I got angry. I trusted him but he trampled my trust. So there came my turn. When I entered the office for the second time, I saw a livid face. "I know all of your plot." went the storm. It was really a long scolding, but I didn't hear any word at all. I was just thinking trust mustn't be trampled and Peter made me too disappointed. As the dean was tired and stopped, I offered my excuse; though cheating was not suitable, I really wanted to help Peter. [sn1,-] "You misunderstand me, [wd4,-] the -whole thing. What made me angry was not your cheating in the exam but that I believed in you, -however, you made full use of it to cheat me." Suddenly, I had an entire idea of the dean's -feeling. I trusted Peter, and he abused my trust. But what I had done. [sn8,-] Everybody needed -feedback for trust.-Several years have passed, but this incident still haunts my mind [cc3,-]. Whenever I want to get -other people's trust.[sn9,-] I am always thinking whether I have the right to deserve it and whether I -will abuse it. Because trust mustn't be trampled.  
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title THE TALE OF CATCHING A CICADA> The story traces back to my naughty boyhood in the countryside, where my -brother, my cousin and I had our most wonderful period of our lifetime.-One day, while we three were rambling in the woods, my cousin happened to -find a cicada crawling on the bark of a poplar. Struck by its sheer blackness and -strange appearance, she couldn't help putting out her hand to touch it. "Ouch!" She -cried out and away flew the cicada, buzzing loudly as if laughing at us. We hurried -to her only to find a scratch on her delicate back of the hand, excoriated [sn3,-]. My -brother and I looked at each other silently. We found the same thing in the other's -eyes: It is time for us men to take some action for the young lady. A cicada should -be caught and punished for the evil his compatriot had done.-We had been told before by the elders that the best way to catch a cicada was -to search on the ground of the woods before dawn, because that was the time for a -larva [np2,-] cicada to slough off into an imago. In order to complete the mission -successfully, we made a fully [wd2,-] preparation and get [vp6,-] armed to teeth. We took -everything useful we could think of: a lampshade (to serve as a net), a shovel (to -smash up its underground palace), two pairs of leather gloves (to defend the attack -from its powerful pincers), string (to tie it up when it was caught), a bar of -chocolate (we thought it was the most delicious thing in the world then, so it could -be used as lure), incense and matches (which often made us coughing, could be -used to force it out, if the chocolate didn't work), and a barrel of water (for the -same purpose).  The moment finally came. We rose up early in the morning, fully equipped, and -set out for the woods. After a quick search, our aim was found drilling out from the -soil. We decided to wait until it turned into cicada. The poor little thing crawled -leisurely towards the nearby bushes (maybe this was the first time he saw the -outside world), not perceiving that two giant monsters [vp9,-] smiling wickedly at him, [sn9,-] not -knowing that the moment [wd4,-] he came to new life turned out to be his doom day [cc1,-]. He -finally crawled onto the branch of the bush, after about twenty minutes, a cicada -exuviated out of the shell. [sn1,-] It was green and its wings were not able to stretch yet. It -was so delicate that we took it home by two fingers, with its weak legs scratching -the hand comfortably itching.-We gave it to the previous victim, wondering what kind of vicious revenge she -would do to him. To our surprise, she happily accepted it as a pet. Again, we -silently looked at each other, shrugged off, and found the same thing in the other's -eyes: Never to guess a woman's heart, or you will be misled to the middle of -nowhere. To catch a cicada was thought to be difficult, but it turned out to be easy. -To fight for someone may be loft [wd2,-], but it turned out to be unnecessary. In the -tumultuary world, how many things there are [sn8,-] which [cj1,-] we have imagined to be right -and helpful finally proved [vp5,-] to be insignificant! I don't know, and I don't want to -think of it, for fear of losing the precious courage god gives us to face our life.

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title The Spring Festival> A.	The first day of the year in lunar calendar B.	Celebrates [vp4,-] the coming of the new year     C. Celebrations 1.	Family celebrations a.	Family reunion b.	Dinner on the night c.	Cracker 2.	Social celebrations a.	A night party on the TV show             b. Shopping days  The Spring Festival The Spring Festival is the most important festival in Chinese tradition. It's on the first -day of the lunar year and most of Chinese people take it more serious than the New Year's day -of solar calendar. Everybody feels so happy because of the coming of the New Year, and with -various means of celebration, the joy [cc1,-] atmosphere is made so clear during the festival period. -Family reunion is for sure [ad2,-]. No matter where or how busy you are, you must go back to family -on those days if you are a Chinese. There will be a large dinner for the whole family on the -New Year's Eve, indicate [vp5,-] the happiness and reunion of the family. A lot of people go to -restaurant to take it in recent years, but the dinner itself as a ceremony never disappears. Don't -forget the fantastic cracker, though a little dangerous, [sn2,-] people, especially children still love it -very much, and some even go on with it in regardless of the ban in big cities. The celebrations -outside home are also multiform. From the early 80's, CCTV gave a large, splendid night party -on the New Year's Eve each year, and it gradually became a new tradition on the festival. And -of course, the merchants will feel in heaven during these days, how can a person, no matter rich -or poor, resist [vp3,-] the temptation of shopping in such a good season? [sn1,-] People go out to buy various -things to send to friends, relatives, or just enjoy themselves.

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title One Unforgettable Match> I am a member of the Student's Bridge Club, and last semester, I took part in several matches held in this university. Since I am a green hand, I learned a lot of skills in bridge playing in these matches. But one match, I think, means much more than teaching me how to play bridge well. It was one Sunday afternoon. The sun was shining brightly and it was very warm. My partner and I went to the New Hydraulic Building in this university. There were many players in the classroom, which made the classroom much warmer, even hot. Every one felt sleepy because we had just finished a match in the morning. -At two o'clock, the match began. As the match going on, I felt more and -more active, and the thought of sleeping went away. One hand, [sn2,-] when I picked up -my thirteen cards, they were: Spade A K J 10 9 8 3, Heart Q 4 3, Diamond K J 2, -and Club 6. I opened with one spade, and after several rounds of bidding, we -reached the final contract seven spade. I am the dealer. After my opponent led a -club, my partner showed his cards. I saw they were: Spade Q 8 7 2, Heart A K 9 2, -Diamond A 4 3, and Club A 2. It seemed not difficult to accomplish this slam. The -first idea occurred to me was that I should try the opportunity in diamond, that is to -say, if the diamond Queen was held by the one on my right hand, I could easily -make it. So after I winning the first trick, [sn3,-] I led the diamond 3 from my partner's -side and put on Jack myself. Unfortunately, the one on my left hand had diamond -Queen, and he won this trick. Thus I lost the contract. After that, my partner told -me that I should try the opportunity that the division of heart on opponent's side -was three to three. (If it was so, I could make the heart 9 win the thirteenth trick -and made the slam. And actually if I had done so, I would have won.) But the -attaching to the first thought made me miss it.-After that, I learned that in a bridge match, sometimes one should not trust -his first idea too much, and he should find the best way to make a contract. And it -is so with real life, isn't it?  Outline  
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title The Spring Festival> Date:    from New Year of Chinese lunar calendar History:  more than 4000 years Activities & Special things:          Spring Festival couplets          New Year paintings          Paper-cut for window decoration          A big dinner to celebrate the reunion           Dumplings & New Year cakes          Lantern riddles          Crackers          Visits to another           New Year cards           Money given to children  The Spring Festival The Spring Festival is the most important festival for Chinese people. Unlike other festivals, it lasts a period of [wd5,-] almost half a month, after beginning on New Year of Chinese lunar calendar. The Spring Festival has such a long festival [wd3,-] that we can even chase [wd3,-] it to more 4000 years ago.-It's a custom that Chinese people begin to attach Spring Festival couplets -and New Year paintings on doors and decorate windows with all kinds of paper cuts several days before Spring Festival. But now, this tradition can rarely been seen now [wd6,-].-Most people get a long holiday and go back home however far they are -from their hometown, for Spring Festival means family reunion for Chinese people.  Always, there is a big dinner to celebrate the reunion of family members on the last -day of a year, which is also regarded as the symbol of the arrival of Spring Festival. -People eat dumplings and New Year cakes in this festal atmosphere since their [wd2,-] -pronunciations of the two kinds of food mean good luck.-There are also many social activities in Spring Festival. In ancient times, -people used to go out to attend all kinds of gatherings, and appreciate beautiful -lanterns while trying to work out the riddles written on them. Now, the situation is -different, [sn9,-] people seem to have grow out of this tradition, and prefer going shopping -or just entertaining themselves at home. [sn1,-] Unlike lantern riddles, crackers, [sn9,-] which are -requisite in Spring Festival, are still very popular among people, especially among -children. People like setting off crackers not only because it creates a jovial -atmosphere but also because it [wd6,-] means promotion, and they believe that setting off -crackers can bring themselves and their family a fortunate year. In the period of -Spring Festival, people spend much time in visiting relatives and friends to offer -New Year greetings [cc3,-], and recent years it is very popular to make a phone call to -offer greetings [cc3,-]at the very moment that [cj1,-] the New Year begins.-There are several special things in Spring Festival, one being New Year -card. [sn2,-] People used to send cards to best friends and relative [np6,-]. And now, with the -popularization of Internet to ordinary families, more and more people choose to -send e-cards, which is much more convenient. Children can get special gift [np6,-], [wd4,-] money, -from their parents and grandparents in Spring Festival. The money is given to them -as token wish [np6,-] for a good year and healthy growth.

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title A Perfect Locksmith> It was another boring afternoon in the office. Our boss was out on a business trip. I needed it to drive away my own drowsiness. Back in my section, having had a sip of coffee, I reached down to the coffer to get some confidential files I was assigned to check. I remembered the code clearly. It was " [sn9,-] the date on which I acquired this dead-end job. But to my surprise, the coffer just refused to open. I tried again. Still no way, 'There must be something wrong'. I said to myself, looking up at the clock on the desk, [sn9,-] which read three-twenty. I knew I couldn't wait. If I did not finish the report on those files today, I would lose the job. I phoned Mr Johnson, a locksmith who had just started his business. Actually, he just got out of prison. He was sentenced to [pp1,-] ten years behind the bar for a serial burglary. But the last time I opened a safer, I got $50,000.'We all laughed as suddenly he took out a pistol and pointed it at me.It was hard to imagine what happened. He opened a coffer, but not the one I wanted him to open. It was the one in which my boss hid the $100,000 cash he just appropriated from the company.-' Don't you think I'm lucky I get even more this time?'    
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title A Chinese Holiday> Outline  The Laba Festival I.	The date of the festival II.	The main custom Laba porridge 1.	Record in document 2.	Cooking method 3.	Nutritive value 4.	Today's custom    The Laba Festival  The eighth day of the 12th lunar month is a traditional festival of our country ¨C Laba. On Laba the main custom is to eat 'Laba porridge'. Laba porridge, also called five flavor porridge or seven-delicious porridge, is cooked with many kinds of rice, beans, nuts, and vegetables. The earliest Laba porridge that was put down in writing -was in Song Dynasty. It has been morn than 1000 years up to now. Every time it was -Laba, not only the common people, but also the imperial family, feudal officials and -Buddhist monks was [vp3,-] to cooked [vp5,-] and ate [vp5,-] Laba porridge. The raw material of Laba -porridge could be any amount, could be odds and ends. [sn1,-] The cooking method was quite -simple. Commonly, the barleycorns [np6,-] , red beans, and mung [fm1,-] beans are washed clean [wd2,-], and -parboiled first. Then the rice and millet are put in. At last there are the jujubes, -chestnuts, lotus seeds, longans and the sugar. Cook them by roaring fire, and then -boil down by slow fire. Laba porridge has been of great nutritive value as well as -being delicious and melting. It was believed that [wd4,-] could build up people's health. To [pp1,-] -this day, it was still kept in many regions like Peking, the Northeast, the Northwest, -north Shantung, and central Anhwei etc. to eat Laba porridge. Along with the -ceaseless enhance [wd2,-] of the standard of living, the raw material is more abundant, and -the cooking method is more recherch¨|.
