I rode on my bike in hence [wd7,-] because I had a compulsory course right away.  The sunshine was pleasant and -I noticed there were many new posts along the main road. I appreciated the colorful designs [sn9,-] while without glasses, I could not read the contents. But judging from the situation, I thought there would be some exciting activities recently. On stepping into the classroom I noticed most of the boys in our class had arrived but chosen the seats at the back. How strange! Usually they run in at the last moment.  With wondering about this, I walked slowly to find a suitable seat. A girl classmate called me with a smile,' Hey, come here!' Great! I ran over and took off the bag. Just then a boy came over, with a red rose and a card sent before me, 'Happy the festival!' I was so surprised that couldn't help staring at him. [sn8,-] 'It is -girls' day today!'  I had forgotten it completely so you can imagine my expression at that time.  All the boys laughed. Perhaps the more surprise from girls, the more happiness of the boys.  After reading the card, I was even moved and said to my neighborhood, 'We had better do something for these lovely boys in return. For example, we can date a certain day as boys' day of our class.' She thought for a while and laughed,' How about April 1st? Then we can send tricks -back as presents without being punished!'  It was really a good start of the day. Even the boring lesson seemed acceptable. Time passed -quickly before I knew it. After the class, I found the campus a sea of flowers.  Outside the 7th dining-hall there was a desk packed with red roses prepared for the boys presenting [vp2,-]their  girlfriends. Besides there were also some interesting toys for free.  It was impossible to leave  with nothing back! On May 8th the girls seemed the most beautiful. And because 'you are blessed so I am happy',  the boys who organized the whole affairs got a sense of achievement and satisfaction. I think it  doesn't matter whether girls' day or boys' day. The most important is that we find out our own way  to enjoy both ourselves and lives.                                                                 
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title IT'S  WORTH  DOING>   It was August already, but the weather of the grassland was still very cool. My parents and I,  with some other people, walked along the path in the grass, appreciating the beautiful setting sun,  when the huge balloon floating in the air seized our sight [cc3,-].    Walking nearer, we could see that it was a kind of entertainment. A tourist paid the money and  then he can sit [vp6,-] in the chair beneath the balloon, and be lifted up into the sky for some time. The  idea of floating in the air and facing the great green ground [cc3,-] took all my heart. I wanted to have a  try, but I must wait, for there were still several people before me.    Wait, wait, [sn6,-] the big monster up and down. [sn1,-] Suddenly, the weather changed. There came a  ferocious wind and the sky got darker. The man in charge of the balloon said,?° That's all for  today." What? But I must go back home the next day! I was so worried, unwilling to miss this  chance, [sn1,-] but how?- [sn9,-] I turned to Father. He looked at the sky, then looked at me. [sn1,-]  "You really want to  do that, don't you?" Father asked me in a very gentle voice. I nodded. He thought for a few  seconds, then said to the balloon-charger, [sn1,-]?° Sir, just one more time, OK? We'll be back home  tomorrow." "But you know that'll be very dangerous!" The man shouted. "Yes, I know. But you  see, we can finish it before the wind does any harm." Father said firmly, [sn1,-] then we all looked at the  charger, eyes full of pleas [sn2,-]. "So, OK, [sn1,-] come on, but be quick!" The man finally agreed. I  immediately ran over to him.    They had expected to raise me little by little, but the wind was too hard. The balloon was blown  to a certain direction and [vp9,-] rising sharply at the same time. I just heard the air whistling past my  body and the whole grassland came into view. The world was quiet and magic. I stretched my  arms, enjoying the cool feeling of air running through my fingers and the golden red gleaming of  the setting sun. This is a completely fresh space for me.    Then and there, I looked down to find the people under me were turbulent. They held the belt  which tied the balloon to the ground and wanted to pull me back. But I [pr1,-] seemed out of control.  They spent all the strength but the balloon just slid side to side at [wd4,-] an altitude and the people were  dragged side to side, too. Some passers-by joined them. I could hear the noise from under. The  strong wind played [wd3,-] me just as played [wd3,-] a fallen leaf.  A long time passed. In the end, my feet touched the ground again. I ran to my parents. Looking  at me, Father said, "I'm afraid now. I should have been afraid before that. You may don't know  just now how nervous we were. We thought that if the tie was not tough enough we will [vp6,-] lose you."  "Yes, that is. But Pa, you don't know what I saw above was so wonderful that I'll [vp6,-] never forget it."  "That's good enough," Father smiled, "You had a hazardous trip while you think it's worth  doing that, [sn6,-] then all is right. [sn1,-]"              
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title The Way to the Children's Palace> When I was seven, I used to learn dancing in the Children's Palace. The training program was from 3.00 till 6.00 in the afternoon. It was a windy and rainy summer afternoon. At 2.30, I started [vp2,-] my way to the Children's  Palace after one day's study at school. I should have taken a certain bus, got off after three stops,  and changed to another bus for five stops. If I have had done all these right, it would have taken  me about half an hour to get to the program. Yet somehow, I got lost that afternoon. Maybe it was because the wind and the rain had  distracted my attention, [sn1,-] maybe I was in such a hurry that I forgot to keep counting the stops, or  maybe, it was just natural for a child to get lost. Fortunately, after circling the same block for several times, [sn3,-] it suddenly occurred to me that I  had possibly been to that place before. With the help of my blurry [fm2,-] memory, I finally found the way  back home. Grandpa was at home then. He was very surprised at seeing me soaking wet.  "Didn't you take your umbrella with you?" Grandpa asked. "Yes," I murmured, "but I forgot to open it." Grandpa quickly took out a towel and began drying my hair while I felt a tempting smell from  the kitchen. I suddenly got hungry, [sn6,-] very hungry indeed. "Mm, let me have some comforting  refreshment." I said to myself. Grandpa began to chat with me when I was busy enjoying the food. "So, your program ended a lot earlier this time. It's only five o'clock now." "No, I lost my way when going to the Children's Palace. I spent much time finding the way  back. Anyway, I succeeded at last." With pride I told grandpa my adventurous story. Grandpa became quiet.  When we arrived at the Children's Palace that afternoon, it was nearly 5.30. The instructor there  was surprised to see me, "I thought you wouldn't come today. It's so late now, and the weather is  bad." Grandpa smiled at me. And with pride again, I knew what he meant. Yes, even to this day, I can clearly recall grandpa's words on the way to the Children's Palace.  "If you have chosen something, you can never give it up easily. Remember, persistence is always  of most importance on your way to success." A Traditional Chinese Holiday  
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Spring Festival> A.	Date 1.	January 1st in lunar year 2.	A period of time from December 23rd till January 15th in lunar year B.	Celebrates [vp5,-] the beginning of a Chinese year C.	Family celebrations 1.	Family reunion 2.	Delicious food, especially, dumplings 3.	Visiting relatives and friends  4.	Money given to children as a Spring Festival gift 5.	Spring Festival scrolls 6.	Fireworks D.	Social celebrations 1.	New Year tolls in temples 2.	Special and splendid TV shows  The Spring Festival is one of the most important holidays in China. Generally speaking, it is  on January 1st in lunar year; yet sometimes, it also means the whole period of time from December  23rd till January 15th  (the Lantern Festival) in lunar year. The holiday is so called because it is the  beginning of a new spring, [sn9,-] and a new year. On the night before the Spring Festival, the whole  family gathers together and has a grand delicious dinner, [sn9,-] among which the dumplings (called Jiao  Zi) are usually necessary. During the holiday, people are busy visiting relatives and friends,  sending New Year wishes to each other, giving money or some other gifts to children. [sn1,-] The Spring  Festival scrolls [wd3,-] appearing on the doors of many families make a warm and happy atmosphere, as if  they were [vp6,-] telling people the spring is coming. At night, the sky is lightened by various kinds of  fireworks. The celebrations are not limited within the family; the whole society whoops it [pr1,-] up.  Temples have special activities, such as the New Year tolls at midnight. Hearing the blessing tolls  on the Spring Festival is said to ensure good luck in the new year. TV stations also make  enormous efforts. Movies, TV series and other special programs abound; watching CCTV's  annual party on Spring Festival Eve has become a new tradition for most Chinese.     
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title The Importance of a Daily Newspaper>  Outline A.	Compared to non-daily newspaper [np6,-] 1.	Reports news in time 2.	Let [vp3,-] the press communicate with the public more effectively 3.	Makes the series easier to follow (if there is some) B.	Compared to TV news report 1.	Easier to keep for later reference 2.	Can be read at any time C.	Other [pr1,-]  1.	Provides people with fresh relaxation everyday 2.	Helps people kill time   
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title A Party With High School Classmates>      In a bright winter evening, the soft moonlight was shining on me. I was going to attend a  party for the returning of two high school classmates from Singapore. I rode my prized bike with a [np7,-]  unusual high speed. When I reached [wd3,-], almost all my high school classmates had come. They were all inquiring of  the two [vp2,-] the experiences in Singapore. It seemed that they had gained many experiences there.  They learned not only the knowledge in books, but also some practical skills. Such as, they  learned haircut [cc3,-] because to have a haircut there would cost about 20RMB; they did part-time job [np6,-] so  as to live better. Their every courses [np3,-] were [vp3,-] much practical than ours. In the end of every semester,  they should did oral presentation. I had never did [vp6,-] any test like that, it was an absolute new thing to  me. [sn1,-] "we really learned something abroad", they said. Other classmates in Tsinghua or Peking University also shared their experience [np6,-] with all of us.  A classmate in Electric Engineering Department of Tsinghua University told us that he learned a  number of difficult specialized courses, and he got high marks. His average mark were 95. So he  won the first-class Scholarship of the Electric Engineering Department. It was amazing, although I  knew that him was a genius. Reflecting on my marks of average 85, I felt I should work much  harder the next semester. When my best friend told me that he were learning French that [pr1,-] semester, I was surprised.  Although I had ever planned to learn a second foreign language, but I didn't learn any for two  semesters. In comparison with him, I wasted a lot of time. A classmate were [vp3,-] elected to be the Student Union's chairman of Psychology Department of  Peking University. He really gained his position [cc3,-] in his department. It [pr2,-] showed his ability in  organizing.  The best singer of our original class declared that she entered [wd3,-] the top ten singers of Peking  University. In high school, she only won the second among tens of singers. But then she won the  top ten among thousands of singers. We all congratulated her for her success. She did what she  didn't finish [wd3,-] in high school. She was a successor. What did I did [vp6,-] that semester? I thought hard. I only established a web site in the internet; I  only wrote a little software; I only finished my specialized courses and won a third-class  scholarship of my department. I didn't make much progress in studying; I didn't attend many  activities; I didn't gain any position [cc3,-] in my department. When I shared my experiences with others,  I was afraid to be laughed. But to my surprise, after my statements, they all attracted by my web  site. They all considered it a wonderful thing, and they desired to visit it. I felt much better then. A  classmate in Computer Science Department of Peking University was envious of my software. "It  should have strong determination to write a software [cc3,-]", she said. I felt glad then. I never thought of  it.  May be it is truth [np6,-]: what you did and you [wd6,-] despise [vp6,-], [sn9,-] may attract others.   

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Mid-Autumn Festival> Outline The mid-autumn festival A.	Celebrated on 15 August in the Chinese Lunar Calendar B.	The reason why people celebrate the mid-autumn festival 1. Brightest moon in the whole year 2.	Family reunion C.	How people celebrate the festival. 1.	Traditional ways a. Eating mooncakes and fruits, drinking tea and Sweat Osmanthus wine b. Enjoying the moonlight c. Telling old stories and myths about the moon 2.	Other ways a. Having reunion parties b. Watching special TV programs designed for the festival c. Telephoning the family members that cannot go home  Being a traditional Chinese festival of special significance, the mid-autumn  festival is celebrated all over the country in the evening of 15 August in the  Chinese Lunar Calendar, the middle of the autumn; [sn9,-] and [fm3,-] the festival is  therefore named. However, the importance of the festival lies in another name  of it, a more beautiful and romantic one¨C the moon festival. Why is that, [sn9,-] you [fm3,-]  may ask. Firstly, it's because at the night of the festival, the moon goes  rounder, bigger and brighter than any other night of the year. Secondly, in  China, people see the full moon as a symbol of family reunion, so the festival  becomes a day of family reunion. On that day, people tried [vp6,-] their best to go  home and reunite with other family members, especially those that [cj1,-] don't meet  the family often. People have various ways to celebrate the mid-autumn  festival. Traditionally, the whole family sits in the open air, drinking tea and  sweat Osmanthus wine, eating mooncakes and fresh fruit, and enjoying the  brightest moonlight of the year. The kindly old [cc6,-] Grammy would tell the old  myths and stories about the moon. But nowadays, people find other ways to  celebrate the festival. Such as holding family reunion parties, watching special  TV programs designed for the festival, and sometimes telephoning the family  members whom are not able to go back home. [sn2,-]

The most detailed news and a lot of comments, [sn2,-] so that people can get a clear idea of what  have happened II.	Provides various kinds of information to satisfy different needs A.	Newest financial information B.	All kinds of useful knowledge C.	Leisure sections D.	Advertisements of job, accommodation and product III.	Could be used after reading as wiper, wrapper, book cover, etc 1.An Outline of " The Importance of a Daily Newspaper" I.	information A.	news at home and broad 1.	important events; 2.	diplomatic affairs; 3.	warfare; 4.	sports . B.	information on economy, culture, science and health 1.crucial directing policies; 2.inventions and discoveries; 3.new theories and criticism; 4.disease and hygiene. C.	things around you. II.	 relaxation A.	novels; B.	comics; C.	essays. III.	communication A.	opinions of both readers and editors; B.	advertisements   

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Spring Festival> 1)Outline I.	Spring Festival A.	The first day in the Chinese lunar year B.	Celebrating for [vp1,-] the beginning of the new Chinese year and praying for the fortune and health  of the coming year [sn2,-] C.	Public celebrations  1.	Firecrackers 2.	Temple Fair 3.	Pay a New Year call D.	Family celebrations 1.	Big family get-together 2.	Yasuiqian(money given to children as a gift during lunar New Year) 3.	Dumplings 4.	Evening show by CCTV   Spring Festival When we talk about festivals, Spring Festival will come first. It [pr2,-] is not only because it comes on  the first day of the lunar New Year, but also it has great significance for Chinese all over the world.  Maybe it is as important as the Christmas Day in western countries. We Chinese regard spring as the beginning of a new year. At the beginning of the new year, we  always have great wishes for the coming year. So celebrations for [np1,-] the Spring Festival in China  also mean that. You can see that from the greetings at that time ¨C [sn9,-] all of them are best wishes for  the new year's fortune and health. With the development of the society, many new customs have  joined the old ones. Both of them have made up of [vp2,-] the celebrations of the Spring Festival. Go down town on Spring Festival, [sn3,-] you may find some Temple Fairs. Because in the old days,  there were always some fairs around temple [np6,-], the name of  "Temple Fair" continued. [sn1,-] In the  countryside, there are also some small fairs a few days before the Spring Festival. There you can  find dragon-lantern play [np6,-] and stilt [np6,-], etc. People play in great din of gongs and drums, expressing the  joyance [fm2,-] and wishes for another harvest year. When the night curtain falls down, firecrackers and  fireworks display became [vp6,-] the theme everywhere. Colorful fires with resounding crack. [sn2,-] You may  feel deaf after hearing that, but that won't diminish your happiness [cc3,-]. But to the concerns of  pollution and public health, governments in big cities began [vp6,-] to control the fireworks .So cassettes  of firecrackers' sound became [vp6,-] popular in some big cities. Paying a new year call is also essential  to Chinese. You can find people busy shuttling from place to place to send their best wishes.  Telephone, mobile phones, beepers and email release people [cc3,-] a lot. They can enjoy [vp2,-] themselves   saying  "Happy Spring Festival" to friends and folks without hustle. For those who work and study far away from their hometowns, Spring Festival means more.  Then a big family get-together is always on the Spring Festival's Eve. All the members sit around  the [np7,-] table to share the delicious Nianyefan (New Year's Eve Dinner). And dumplings are essential  to everyone. In my hometown ¨C Shandong ¨Cdumplings have various tastes, you may find a coin in  one dumpling if you are lucky enough. [sn1,-] After that nearly all of us will stay up in front of the TV to  watch the evening by CCTV and wait for the coming of a new year. With the development of the society, Spring Festival has changed a lot. But one thing will not  change that the Chinese people's best wishes for the peace and happiness! [sn7,-] Is there any girl in the world who doesn't want an elder brother?    Is there any girl in the world who doesn't want an elder brother?    Well, at least I've never seen any girl saying so. On the contrary, for all these years I've been  growing up with girls fancying having [vp5,-] an elder brother, [sn1,-] imagining him as tall and handsome, cool  to the other girls but kind to the topmost level when facing her [sn2,-]. He would do her homework, play  with her when it is boring, comfort her when she is frustrated, and buy her unexpected but  fantastic gifts now and then.    Well, I must admit that I do have a brother, tall, handsome, and smart. That's what makes me  the most envied one among all the girls in the neighborhood since primary school years.  It [pr2,-]'s not  that [cj1,-] my brother has so much glamour that my fellow girls like him even to the point of hating me,  but that [cj1,-] having a brother is something really [ad1,-] not bad. I can guess from their attitudes they must be  jealous of me though they do not say so.     You must be thinking that I am quite proud of it. But to tell you the truth, [sn2,-] if any girl had  expressed her longing for a brother in my face at that time, I would at once "transmit" my brother  to her, without any reluctance. What? You said I'm too cruel? You don't understand what a devil  my brother was when we were small [wd3,-].    In the summer when I was three and my brother was just over eight, my mother took us for a  walk in the evening. She put me in a baby wheelchair, and asked my brother to care for his little  sister. My brother, out of his interest in the wheelchair, played with it at his will. He swung it from  side to side swiftly, and back and forth, taking no notice of his scared-to-death little sister in the  hell-like wheelchair. Maybe he felt it still not stimulating enough, or he wanted to test the hardness  and the stability of the wheedle, whatever, [sn1,-] he dropped hold of it suddenly and let it slid down the  street, [sn9,-] where cars passed like wind constantly. God must be watching me at that time, for no car  hit me or I won't [vp6,-] be able to sit here and tell this story to you. But my wheelchair hit the edge of  the pedestrian's walk along the street, and this accident left a scar on the left side of my face. The  psychological effect of this terrible accident is so severe that for a considerably long time since  then, I screamed whenever my brother tried to talk to me. As my brother explained to me later, every boy wants [vp6,-] to have a little brother, so they can play  fighting games together, but a sister [sn2,-]! He shrugged at the thought of it. Little girls were all fussy, [sn9,-]  and troublesome. He just wanted someone to play with, but there came someone who needed to be  taken care of all the time! Every time when he tried to explain the accident in this way, I would  retort that there was no silly girl who ever wants [vp6,-] a brother, especially an elder one [sn2,-], boring and  cruel [sn2,-]. Instead, an elder sister would be fantastic: you can wear her clothes, confide your secrets to  her and get millions of marvelous gifts from her. [sn9,-] An elder sister? [sn9,-] My brother laughed, [sn9,-] Oh, only  silly girls like you want elder sisters to order you doing [vp5,-] errand [np6,-] [cc3,-] around. [sn9,-]  So, you see, my brother and I had tremendous difficulty in communicating, [sn1,-] I guessed that is  because our minds are made of different materials at born [pp2,-]. Wait, [sn2,-] maybe we are not brother and  sister indeed, hmm, that may well explain why we don't coordinate. [sn1,-] I began to imagine him being  discarded by his original parents, on a deserted street in a cold winter night, [sn2,-] when my parents  passed and out of sympathy for him, [sn9,-] took him home and have [vp6,-] been treating him just as their own  son since then. [sn2,-] Ah, I should tell him the truth, anyhow he's old enough now, he has the right to  know his own destiny. [sn1,-] I said to myself complacently when suddenly thunder-like sounds burst  from outside the room and I knew it's devil [np6,-] knocking on the door. "I won't open the door for you,  come in and watch TV if you are so apt. [sn1,-]" There was a period of quietness, and I suddenly saw  slips of paper came [vp5,-] in from under the door. I jumped up and screamed, for it was my favorite  storybook. I opened the door and there stood him, with a triumphant air on him face, "I win, [sn9,-]  again." That was really what happened in our childhood, [sn1,-] I just can't imagine how, in some families,  brothers and sisters live together happily or at least, without fight, tears, peace negotiation,  compromise and treason time and time again, [sn2,-] which, in my eyes, are all indispensable children  experiences in their growing process. [sn2,-] I always complained to my parents of my brother's  malicious nature and ruthless deed [np6,-] when we were small [wd3,-], but it is the same person who boasts  everyday to her roommates of her great and thoughtful brother now. I can't tell when and how this  change happened, but we did begin to be proud of each other. I used to point to the name list of  excellent students in the display window of our secondary school, and declared to my friends,  "This is my brother, he's now in Tsinghua! [sn1,-]", and I heard my brother bragging proudly to his  classmates, [sn2,-] "My sister's got another English prize, [sn1,-] she's top student in this school and she leaves  no room for me to stand on!" But we still fight at home, over trivial things such as whose turn it  was to wash the dishes, or which TV channel to watch. It seems that we have got accustomed to  this way of expressing that we are brother and sister, we are familiar with and fond of each other. [sn1,-]  Contradictory? No, you would never understand this kind of unsaid affection if you were not  lucky enough to have a brother. As I look back, I am wondering that it seems we have grown up in just one night. Now I am  in the prominent university that he has just graduated from, and he is now in America pursuing his  graduate study. Every time he came back, he would bring me millions of marvelous gifts, and we  would talk nonsense, just as before. I like to talk nonsense with him, it [pr2,-] makes us feel close to each  other. [sn1,-] But, as he pointed out in a birthday card for me last year, this kind of chance would be fewer  and fewer. He wrote, "You are already 19 years old, and after another 19 years, our lives might be  well established, but I am always fearing that we would be more and more apart unavoidably as  time goes by." At the sight of these lines, I just couldn't help my tears from dropping. One weekend, when we were tidying [vp2,-] the house, I found two sheets of thin paper in an iron  box. As I soon made out, they were the birth certificates of my brother's and mine! On them were  my mother's name, the exact time of birth, the weights of the newly-borns, and the signatures of  the doctor and the nurses in charge. I found out that we were brought to earth by the same doctor!  Well, I must admit, after a long game of kidding, that he is my brother. I knew it, because the  blood relationship is there. "I won't open the door for you,  come in and watch TV if you are so apt." There was a period of quietness, and I suddenly saw  slips of paper came in from under the door. I jumped up and screamed, for it was my favorite  storybook. I opened the door and there stood him, with a triumphant air on him face, "I win,  again." That was really what happened in our childhood, I just can't imagine how, in some families,  brothers and sisters live together happily or at least, without fight, tears, peace negotiation,  compromise and treason time and time again, which, in my eyes, are all indispensable children  experiences in their growing process. I always complained to my parents of my brother's  malicious nature and ruthless deed when we were small, but it is the same person who boasts  everyday to her roommates of her great and thoughtful brother now. I can't tell when and how this  change happened, but we did begin to be proud of each other. I used to point to the name list of  excellent students in the display window of our secondary school, and declared to my friends,  "This is my brother, he's now in Tsinghua!", and I heard my brother bragging proudly to his  classmates, "My sister's got another English prize, she's top student in this school and she leaves  no room for me to stand on!" But we still fight at home, over trivial things such as whose turn it  was to wash the dishes, or which TV channel to watch. It seems that we have got accustomed to  this way of expressing that we are brother and sister, we are familiar with and fond of each other.  Contradictory? No, you would never understand this kind of unsaid affection if you were not  lucky enough to have a brother. As I look back, I am wondering that it seems we have grown up in just one night. Now I am  in the prominent university that he has just graduated from, and he is now in America pursuing his  graduate study. Every time he came back, he would bring me millions of marvelous gifts, and we  would talk nonsense, just as before. I like to talk nonsense with him, it makes us feel close to each  other. But, as he pointed out in a birthday card for me last year, this kind of chance would be fewer  and fewer. He wrote, "You are already 19 years old, and after another 19 years, our lives might be  well established, but I am always fearing that we would be more and more apart unavoidably as  time goes by." At the sight of these lines, I just couldn't help my tears from dropping. One weekend, when we were tidying the house, I found two sheets of thin paper in an iron  box. As I soon made out, they were the birth certificates of my brother's and mine! On them were  my mother's name, the exact time of birth, the weights of the newly-borns, and the signatures of  the doctor and the nurses in charge. I found out that we were brought to earth by the same doctor!  Well, I must admit, after a long game of kidding, that he is my brother. I knew it, because the  blood relationship is there. Is there any girl in the world who doesn't want a brother? I don't believe anyone can be that silly.  It tastes good Forrest Gump's mother said that life was like a box of chocolate. And I think many kinds of  experiences are just like a lot of styles of chocolate with different flavours and tastes. If it is the  first time we eat that kind of chocolates, we can never successfully expect how it tastes. Is it a  sweet milk chocolate or a slightly bitter black chocolate? Is it mixed with peanut or strawberry?   Is it a fresh one or an expired one? All these questions cannot be answered correctly until we have  put one into our mouth. The condition is the same when we experience something new, [sn9,-] No matter  how well we are prepared, we always run into something unexpectedly.   Raising fund for an activity sounded challenging and interesting. Although I was a layman to  that task, I took it over. I ever heard that "be prepared, or you won't make it", so I spent half a  week in making all kinds of preparations. As I thought making a telephone call was more polite   than visiting the office, I found a telephone book and transcribed dozens of telephone numbers  without noticing that the telephone book was published three years ago. Then the next thing to do  was to choose a lucky day to call them. It was a clear day. And my roommates had gone to the classroom. After a big breakfast [cc4,-] that I  thought could increase my confidence, I sat beside the phone, drew a deep breath, and made sure  that I was clear-minded. As I know [vp6,-] it was a very tough work, I, first of all, thought carefully about  the subject and what question I could expected and most convincing way [np6,-] to answer them. I even  wrote some key points on a yellow pad. Unexpectedly, that most deliberate preparation I had ever  made rendered nervous [wd7,-]. Realizing that I had wasted a lot of time in thinking the too detailed  problems and [wd4,-] getting my nerve more and more tense, I had to start my work. I could not remember  how I picked up the telephone, pressed the button [sn1,-]. When the unacquainted voice came from the  other side of the phone, I suddenly revived and spat out the entire subject as quickly as I could. To  my shock, the answer from the other side was "sorry, I think you've dialed the wrong number", [sn9,-]  "no this is not the Shell Company". Thinking that failure is the mother of success I made the  second one, [wd4,-] the third one. After being refused for several times I found I had wasted a lot of time  in explaining enthusiastically to an operator of the switchboard and given up easily when hearing  the manager's cold words. Gradually I learned how to illustrate briefly to the operator and how to  talk to the department manager to bring him or her around. However, the whole thing was far  more complicated than I had anticipated. All the bright managers required a fax about the activity  and the budget.   That challenging task suddenly turned into a routine one. I had to write and print the letter,  being obsessed with the title, the tone and the pattern. I felt I turned from an annoying sales dealer  into a patient secretary. Just as an old saying said " nothing is impossible to the effort and courage", our activity got  the biggest certified public accountants' assistant. I made an appointment with the manager to  acquire the donation. Unfortunately it was a rainy and windy day. As credit was the most  important thing, nothing can prevent me from going there. On my way to the office, the rain got  heavier and heavier, moreover the wind destroyed my umbrella. When I stepped into the hall of  the World Trade Center, I was soaked through and like a drenched chicken. The waiter looked at  me pointedly. As I didn't like to be questioned and drove away. [sn2,-] I step forward and asked where is  the CPAs office. He was quite shocked and pointed at the elevator and said "on the eleventh  floor". Through all these unexpected difficulties I got the donation for the activity, and successfully  accomplished the task. That new experience was just like a new style of chocolate to me. It gave me surprise,  achievement and excitement. Nothing can prevent me from taste [vp4,-] it.   

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title The Dragon Boat Festival>  The 5th day of the 5th Chinese lunar month In commemoration of the great patriotic poet Qu Yuan Celebrations: Competing in the dragon-boat race. Eating "Zong Zi" The dragon boat festival is one of the famous traditional Chinese ceremonies. Celebrated on [wd4,-], it is  in commemoration of the great patriotic poet Qu Yuan. He was always in great concern of his  country even in exile. When hearing of [wd2,-] the capital of his motherland had been conquered, he  committed suicide by jumping into the river. In the festival, people compete in the dragon-boat  race. It is said that Qu Yuan is not dead, so people are trying to save him from the river. "Zong Zi"  is the favorite food enjoyed in the festival. It is a pyramid-shaped dumpling made of glutinous rice  wrapped in bamboo or reed leaves. People believe those leaves can protect the sacrificial offerings  from the flood dragon.  

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Three Places In My Country That Tourist Should Visit> The Great Wall Located in North China Used originally as the defense wall against other nations Regarded as the spirit of the Chinese people The Tian'an Men Square Located in the center of Beijing City  The place where national celebrations take place Regarded as the heart of China The Summer Palace Located in the northwestern part of Beijing City The world's largest imperial garden Displaying the harmony of natural beauty and wonderful craft. How to make dumpling? Dumpling is a Chinese traditional food which is famous for its delicacy.  Maybe you think it is difficult to make, but in fact it is quite easy if you make it according to the following sentences. 	First, you must believe that making dumpling is not hard but joyful.  Since most Chinese can do it well, you can do it well too. It [pr3,-] doesn't need  any special technical but the only thing needed is the belief that you  can do it well. Once you have this belief, you will make delicious dumpling  easily. Then, the next step is preparing [vp5,-] the materials. You need such things: soy,  salt , vegetables, mince meat, water, flour and tools: [sn9,-] a roller, a kitchen  knife, [wd4,-] a small scoop. Isn't it [pr2,-] simple? Making dumpling doesn't need any uncommon  materials. Third, you should make the filling. It [pr2,-] is very important because it decides  the dumpling's taste. But don't worry anyway, [sn9,-] if you know how to cook a  dish, then you will find it is rather easy. [sn1,-] Just blend the vegetables which have been cut into pieces with the mince meat, and cut them into stuffing, then  add some salt and soy according your own favour. Thus the stuffing is done. The forth step is making [vp5,-] the wrapper. Maybe this step is most difficult [aj3,-].  After mixing the water and the flour and kneading it into dough, you should  cut the dough into small dough which is as big as a one-fourth ping-pang  ball. Then you can press the small dough into wrapper using a roller, which  is rather difficult. You can work in this way: one hand rolls the roller  as the other one sends the dough and rotates it at the same time. Since  you are a beginner, you should do this slowly and  be patient. When you  are familiar with it, you will find it is only a little dish. The last step is to fill the wrapper with the stuffing. This is very easy.  After doing that ,you can cook the dumpling. Then the delicious dumpling  is finished and you can taste it.   

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title How to Make Dumpling> Dumpling is maybe the most famous traditional Chinese food in the world,  here we will learn  to make it. [sn1,-] The process of making dumpling consists of three main steps: preparing  raw materials (the  sheet and filling), wrapping the filling with the sheet, and cooking it. The preparing step is the most complex one. The material of filling is  up to your taste.  Usually it includes meat, vegetables, and flavorings like salt, soy, etc.  Cut them up and mix round  them in a deep container, and then we can leave it aside and begin with  the sheet. To make sheet, [sn2,-]  first mix round flour and water in certain proportion to make it a stretchy  solid state, and split it  into small pieces, then role them into round shaped sheets with a rolling  pole. Thus the sheet and  filling are ready and we can wrap filling with sheet. Fit one sheet with  about one teaspoon of  filling putted in the center of it [pr1,-], then carefully enclose the sheet. Put  these uncooked dumplings in  a big basin to dry them, then put them into boiled water to steam for about  15 minutes until the  water boil again and the dumplings are all float [vp4,-] up. So the dumpling is ready and we can get them out and enjoy this delicious  food.   

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title TRUST> What is trust?  Trust is often thought to be similar with "to believe", but in fact it's  more than that.  When you say "I believe him", you actually mean you believe what he says,  while when you  say "I trust you", you think he is someone honest and reliable. You can  believe someone as  long as you think he (she) is telling the truth, no matter who he (she)  is and how much you  know about him (her). But can you "trust" a stranger as well?  Obviously the answer is "no". To trust, the first prerequisite is to  understand. The two  factors that trust bases on ,honesty and reliability, are not something  you can find from  someone on the first sight .These characters can only be found and confirmed  through the  understanding between people. Those who deserve your trust, usually are  either your good  friends, or your eldership [wd3,-]. Someone recognized to be honest is sometimes  thought to be  trusty, too. But such trust to [np1,-] a person is of another kind. It [pr2,-]'s like the  admiration to [np1,-] a man of  fame. In such kind of trust, you are just showing your attitude ,like saying  "I trust the  government", and may get no response. But the trust between friends is quite different. It's mutual. Being trusted  is as important  as trusting others. Being trusted means some kind of responsibility and  being regarded,  without which one may feel lonely and the "unbearable lightness of being".  Everybody has  the need for feeling strong by giving others support, as well as a shoulder  to rely on when  feeling weak [sn2,-]. Such feelings make everyone needs [vp5,-] friends, and trust is just  the way to  friendship. Such is trust, an essential factor of friendship. It's more than to believe,  or to help, or to rely, or honesty. It's a basic need of human life.  

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title How To Make Dumplings> Dumpling [np6,-] is the most traditional food in China. Almost every family  eats dumplings on their traditional festival--the spring festival. Making  dumplings is not a trouble job that [cj1,-] you may consider, but it needs correct  process. I'll explain the process in the following paragraphs.  The first step is to prepare the dumpling wrappers. Mix the powder  with water to make dough, [sn9,-] which shouldn't be too soft or too hard. Then  shape the dough into slim column, and cut it into small dough. We can  make the small dough into wrappers with a rolling pin. The good wrapper  is in the shape of fine round, and the center of the wrapper should be  thicker than its rim to prevent stuffing from leaving.  The next step is to make stuffing. The dumpling's stuffing often  contains meat, vegetables and eggs. What we should do is to slice meet,  cut up vegetables, such as Chinese cabbage or chives, beat eggs and mix  all of them together. Then add some condiment to stuffing to make it  more delicious. The taste of stuffing is very important, because the taste  of dumplings depends on it.  We have had the wrappers and stuffing prepared, and now what we  should do is to wrap dumplings. Put some stuffing on a wrapper, then fold  the wrapper and hold it together to make a boat shape. The one thing we  should take care is not to add too much stuffing, otherwise the dumplings  may be torn when boiled. The last thing is to put the dumplings into water  then boil them until they emerge on water.  Now we can have a good traditional meal.   

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title How to Make Jiao Zi (Chinese Dumplings)>     Jiao Zi is a kind of traditional Chinese food. It is famous and popular for  the long history and [wd4,-] delectable taste. Making Jiao Zi is not very difficult.  Everyone can do it under the following instructions, however, practice is very  important, say, [sn1,-] more practice, more gains.      Firstly, let's make dough and "Jiao Zi Pi"(dumpling skins). Add some water  to flour, blend and knead thoroughly. Do not add more water until it is  absolutely necessary, that is, getting as hard a dough as you can. If the dough is  too soft, add more flour. Harder dough is much easier to fill [vp7,-]. Chill [wd7,-] a while before  you make skins.       When chilling the dough, we can prepare the filling. Take out your food  processor. Don't tell me you don't have. It could be terribly tiresome if you try to  mince everything with a knife, especially when you want to serve more people.  However, using a machine or knife [np6,-] is up to you. After meat is finely minced, add  soy sauce and salt to it. Stir slowly, always in the same direction  (this could  make the meat fiber stick well, or [wd3,-] the Jiao Zi are more likely to fall apart when  cooked). Then prepare vegetables and other additional ingredients, for example,  minced cabbage as the main filling, some flavoring like [fm2,-] finely minced ginger,  onion etc. Stir them slowly into the meat mixture. Don't let the mix get too moist.  After the mixture is done, you should test scent [cc3,-]. It should be very aromatic. If  not, add a little sesame oil. Then test consistency. Fry a teaspoon or so of the  mix. It should stick together very easily. If it falls apart, it could be because  either the mix is too dry in which case add more vegetables [sn7,-] or its [fm1,-] too moist in  which case add a little more meat  [sn7,-]. At last, test flavor [cc3,-] . You can eat the fried bit or  make one Jiao Zi as the test or just lick [wd3,-] a little raw thing (not so hygiene, but  convenient). If necessary, add a few spices to supplement [wd5,-].      When the filling is ok, we can continue our work with the dough. Separate  dough into two portions. Form [wd4,-] into long sausages, about 3~4cm diameter [sn2,-]. Cut [wd4,-] sections every 2cm. Form sections into balls and use rolling pin to form into  round, flat skins. You may need extra flour or a little peanut oil for this [wd4,-] in order  to preventing [vp5,-] the dough sticking to your hands and the rolling pin. This step is  probably the hardest in the whole work. If I were you, I would go to the  supermarket to purchase a package of pre-made dumpling skins.      Then we come to the most technical and artistic step--rolling. Take about  1 [wd7,-] tablespoon filling and place into center [np6,-] of skin. Bring one half [wd4,-] up to meet the  other half. Seal thoroughly. This usually means creating "pleats" in one half and  gluing them to the other, Your dumpling should look like a half-moon with a big  bulge in the middle! [sn1,-] If they're not well sealed, they fall apart when cooking [vp5,-].  Please be patient when rolling, how happy you are when seeing more and more  dumpling babies produced by your own hands. [sn1,-]      After one or two hours work, do you get enough Jiao Zi to serve yourself or  your guests or friends? At least you must have some to cook. Bring large pot of  water to boil. Then add enough Jiao Zi to cover the base of the pot. Take good  care of your pot, when water comes to a boil, add 1 cup [np2,-] cold water. [sn1,-] Cover.  Repeat. When it [pr2,-] comes to a boil for the third time, they are ready to serve.       To serve is also dainty. Jiao Zi is typically eaten with a sauce constructed [wd3,-]  of soy sauce, vinegar, and sugar. Also good with plain malt vinegar. [sn2,-] For more  flavor, try to add a little sesame oil, hot oil, [wd4,-] mustard as you wish. Ok, let's stop,  you can enjoy yourself now. [sn1,-] MY TUTOR'S TWO SIDES It has been almost three years since I was directed by my tutor. Like most  teachers in Tsinghua University, he is an ordinary-looking man and often in plain  dress. The appearance makes him looked [vp5,-] like not a profound professor, but a common  retired worker. In my opinion, all professors in Tsinghua University have some  collective characters [cc4,-], but everyone of them is unique. What he impresses me deeply is  his vigorousness [fm2,-] and eloquence. The following two stories are the best proofs. My tutor is sixty years old. He is thin but healthy, in particular, he is good at  walking. [sn1,-] Last term, I went to Kunming with him for a research in Lancang River.  Fortunately, the World Horticultural Expo was performing in the city, so I have a  chance to visit the garden with my old tutor. We got [vp1,-] the garden at about eight o'clock  in the morning. on [fm3,-] a sunshiny day and began our long walking. [sn2,-] The garden was so  tremendous and attractive that we were deeply magnetized by the scene, even we  forgot the tire [wd2,-]. [sn1,-] We had not stopped seeing and walking until we had a brief lunch at  noon. After the lunch, the old man said to me with great exciting [wd2,-], "Let's continue our  visit, the garden is so beautiful. [sn1,-]" After that, I found it difficult to keep up with him  though I had tried my best. We completed our visit at four o'clock in the afternoon.  Our long walking had lasted for more than seven hours except the time for lunch. I  was really tired and felt all parts of my body were sore. At this time, my tutor said to  me, "My boy, are you interested in watching the night scene of the city with me?" I  answered with a bitter smile, "I am interested in watching the night scene of the city  in the bed of the hotel." Another side which makes me admire my tutor is his eloquence. But I think his  eloquence is mostly based on his profound knowledge. Last year, an important group  that would decided [vp9,-] a large contract came to our department. But before our welcome,  the opponent had carried them away [wd3,-] and contacted [vp1,-] with them for a day. The situation  is serious for us. However, when the group arrived and began to talk about the  contract, my tutor made his wonderful speech. He showed them dozens of books  which collected all the research achievements of us and began to talk about his  opinion on the contact. One hour late [aj2,-], when his speech was over, the leader of the  group said, "Excellent, you have got the 75 percent of the contact."  This is my tutor, a common professor of Tsinghua, and an energetic and  well-spoken man.   

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title The classification of professional sports> Most professional sports can be classified as group sports or individual sports,  according to the number of players. Individual sports are those that the players of each side are not more than two  persons, such as golf and tennis, etc. Some kinds of individual sports can play [vp7,-] only [ad1,-] by  single person each side, though golf belongs to these kinds. But other kinds of  individual sports can play [vp7,-] either by single person or by double persons, for example  tennis. Although individual sports can be run among groups sometimes, still they are  called individual sports because one game can not be played by all players at the same  time, but in turns. In facts [np2,-], they are still played by single person or double persons, but  calculated by groups in this situation [wd7,-].  Group sports are those that each side of them is more than two players, such as  football, the most popular sports [np3,-] in the world. The victory of group sports depends on  not only the skill of every player but also the cooperation of the team, and sometimes  super stars are very import [fm1,-] for a team to win the game. There are many other ways to classify the professional sports. But the  classification ahead is a basic and simple one.

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Aims of My Life> One should have his aims of life, and also need to establish, cancel or modify some aims. If  you are pursuing a valuable and regretnessless [fm2,-] life, you had better to clarify the aims of your life.  So I classify the aims of my life as follows. There can be two kinds of aims in all: abstract aims and concrete aims. My abstract aim is living [vp5,-] for the truth, kindness and beauty of the world. This aim is nor [fm1,-] to do  something, but it is the demand thought [fm1,-] my life, and will not be changed [wd4,-] all my life. My concrete aims have too much [np8,-] content [np6,-], so I put them into two categories further: short-tern [fm1,-]  aims and long-term aims. My short-term aims can be different in the next day. They are some concrete things that I have  to do, for example, to finish this English article, to study the project in my laboratory, to get my  Ph.D degree, etc. [sn1,-]  My long-term aims are something to do in all the rest of my life. For example, to make our  electrical products more functional and reliable, to improve my parent's life, to do my best to  repay my teachers and my friends. [sn1,-] All my aims are list above, according to the clarification, and in order not to lose my aims of  life.  

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title A Lovely Girl> She is a very lovely girl. Although she is very short and very [wd6,-] fat, in another words [np2,-], she is not  slim at all, but [cj2,-] nobody will say her body type [cc1,-] is not beautiful; her eyes are big, dark and bright,  her skin is perfect, smooth and tender, but her hair is not so black and long; [sn1,-] she has a relatively  huge head, but she is not very knowledgeable, so she often do something stupid, that [cj1,-] makes  everyone laughing, but nobody will really laugh at her; [sn1,-] her smile is innocent and sweet [sn9,-] and  everyone will be attracted by it.  She is my three years old niece, [sn9,-] whom I often think of in my daily life.  

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title A scene or something introduction>  THVenus-1 Small satellite  Lying in the center of the clean-room is a small satellite called THVenus-1. Sitting on  its launch pad frame, the satellite is a cubic object whose six facets are covered with  thermal panels and brilliantly blazing in the sunshine beam [cc1,-] through the windows. The  size of the satellite is about 90cm wide and 120cm high, not so big as people think a  satellite mostly should be. [sn1,-]  Detached from the thermal panels, the satellite, with cubic Aluminum frame structure  and modular layered stacks, has machined module boxes stacked one on top of the  other to form a body onto which solar panels and instruments may be mounted. The  mass of the satellite is normally from 35 kg to 70 kg and its structure is qualified to  carry up to 35kg payloads. Each module box houses the various subsystems, for  example, batteries, power conditioning, onboard data handling, communications and  attitude control. Payloads are housed either in similar modules or on top of the  earth-directing platform alongside antennas and attitude sensors.  Electronically the satellite uses modern, sophisticated, but not necessarily  space-proven, electronic circuits to provide a high degree of capability. These are  underpinned by space-proven subsystems - resulting in a layered architecture that  achieves high performance with operational redundancy by using alternative  technologies rather than by simple duplication. All the software can be reloaded from  the ground station, increasing the reliability of the satellite and providing the  opportunity to continually enhance the technological function onboard the satellite.  This satellite is mainly used for remote sensing and communication. Mounted with  multi-spectrum cameras that take earth images from 650km orbit at 30m resolution, it  is capable of monitoring the earth disasters such as forest fire and regional flood. An  extra communication payload can also provide some consumer with message store  and forward services.   Small satellite is cost¨Ceffective and has short design, testing and manufacture  time ,because of the use of common commercial components. With more modern  technology integrated and miniaturized, it can be a powerful tool for people to explore  our home planet.   

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title A person I admire> My husband is of medium height and a little fat. Sometimes he is lazy and untidy;  sometimes he likes the delicious food so much, but these are not his main characters.  What really attract me are the following aspects. Same with a lot of peoples who graduated from Tsinghua University, he is clever,  but his intelligence is different from the others. His bright [wd2,-] is not inherent. His  endeavor is the source of it. That is to say[sn9,-] that [wd5,-] he accumulated all of his knowledge by  himself and he [wd6,-] has memorized all of them. I never understand how can [vp9,-] his brain hold  so many things. He can use mathematics in any fields [np3,-]. Obviously, because his specialty is  electronics, math is an important tool for his scientific research. When I asked him a  question that is not relative with math, for example, a chemistry experiment, he will  finally find a math method to solve it. When we fell in love, he used math to study  why we could love each other and whether we would live together in the future. He seldom leaves a question for another day. He often has a lot of new and  wonderful ideas, but the fact is that he often finds a new question before he leaves his  office. He will [wd4,-] think of his supper until he solves that question. If he can't solve it  immediately, he will work all night. When you see him tomorrow morning, he will  tell you the right answer. This is my husband, who is a person I admire more.   

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Western Musical Instruments> A musical instrument can be defined as any mechanism that produces musical sounds. All  western musical instruments usually [ad1,-] are classified in five categories: 1.	String instruments. The violin, viola, cello, double bass, harp and guitar are string  instruments. The strings are the same parts of them. The musician makes a string  vibrate with the right hand and controls pitch by the left hand. "Shanbo Liang and  Yingtai Zhu" is a famous violin concert in our country. 2.	Woodwind and brass instruments.  Woodwind instruments are made of wood, which have a unique tone color. The  piccolo, flute, oboe, and saxophone are members of this group. In our early war films, the trumpet sounds mean all of the soldiers are charging [vp1,-]  the enemy lines. The trumpet is one of brass instruments. The other is born. In "Blue  Danube", the violin first brings us a silent morning of Danube, then the born brings  the main melody to us. 3.	Percussion Instruments. Percussion instruments are subdivided into two parts. One is  definite pitch, for example, the timpani, xylophone, celesta and chimes. The other is  indefinite pitch, including the bass drum, triangle, gong and so on. 4.	Keyboard Instruments. The piano, harpsichord, organ, and accordion are the  well-known keyboard instruments. During the nineteenth and early twentieth  centuries, the piano was a status symbol. Any middle-class family had it.  5.	Electronic Instruments. Same with the name, electronic instruments produce or  amplify sound through electronic means. Instruments also can be classified into the same five categories based on the  way [wd4,-] sound is made. For string instruments, a stretched string is the sound generator;  for woodwind and brass instruments, a column of air is the sound generator; [sn9,-] and so on.    

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Friendship> Xiaowang is a young architect. Last year, he and I entered a bid [cc3,-] of an  office building design. It was a risk for us. The task would be calculated  to cost 15000 yuans. If we would not win the bid, we could only get  10000 yuans. If we were lucky to win, we could get 50000 yuans.   Unfortunately, we lost the bid. [Both] Xiaowang and I wasted about 2500  yuans [wd4,-] each other. Although we felt depressed on the result, we  cooperated harmoniously. Friendship between us has gone [a] step further.  We decided that we would work together next time if we had a chance. Two months ago, our group went to qufu [fm3,-] in Shandong for a visit. It is a  famous tour city. When we talk about how to begin our visit in hotel hall,  a stranger came to us. He asked us whether we would need help or not. In  fact we thought a tourist guide was necessary. We supposed that he could  make our trip efficiently [wd2,-]. He guided us enthusiastically [for the] whole  day and his service satisfied with [vp1,-] us. Finally, we paid for him 30 yuans,  which he required. Before he went away, he said: "we became friends  now, welcome to qufu [fm3,-] again. [sn1,-]" But I thought no one of us regarded him as a friend. I consider that friendship is not to be paid for. Everyone wish [vp3,-] that your  friend would help you with no commercial aim. Take the case a man [vp9,-] trying to decide whether to save a child who can not swim in a river or  not. If he save [vp3,-] him for a high prize, most of us must think that he is not a  noble person. If he just want [vp3,-] to save a life for nothing, he is regarded as a  hero. Friendship can't be judged by money. The real friend is someone  who will help you if you need help not for benefiting from. Still, we have trouble coming up with a precise definition of friendship.  In some Chinese traditional novels, friendship means to contribute  everything to your friend even a life if they need. The most famous example  is about three people who became brothers in a peach garden. They vowed to dedicate their lives to each  other and they kept their promises at the end. Their names are liubei, guanyu and zhangfei. Guyu even had  became a god of friendship in many old Chinese's hearts. But money is coming more important now. We are  thrown into confusion of the relations between money and emotion. It may be a joke if the story of three  brothers happens in modern society. Today it seems that the standard of friend is lower than before. The  model of friend, which we often describe, is [wd4,-] who will listen to you when you talk about your problems or  whom you can argue with and not lose your temper [sn6,-]. Although they can not contribute their lives to their  friends, they are faithful. The most important character is that friendship can't be got  [bought] by money.

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title Comparison between online and offline education> Both online and offline education now exist well in China.  Online education is a new mode of education, while offline education is a traditional one. Compared with  traditional education, online education will fundamentally change teaching techniques. In the new mode of online education, teacher's [np6,-] function will mainly be to guide and organize the students [np1,-],  while the students themselves will take the learning process. But in the traditional mode, educators need to  impart the knowledge, as well as help students design their learning schedule [np6,-]. Computer becomes very important in online education, as an essential teaching tool. In traditional education,  the most basic and important implements are chalk and blackboard. During online class, teachers will give the students more time to think and talk, in order that[wd5,-] to develop their  comprehensive abilities . As a typical character, only teachers always being [vp9,-] talking all along,  [wd4,-] students get few  chances to speak and think in traditional class. However, based on the application of Internet technology, online education will cost very much now in China.  As the low speed and high cost of Internet services, offline education still be provided and exists well.

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title The Person I Admire Most>      Everybody has someone to admire, maybe a star, a famous figure, or his  intimate person. For me, this character is my elder brother, who is strong-minded,  valorous, and virtuous. He made me wiser and kinder, and taught me how to face life  calmly.      When he was a child, my brother dreamed of controling [fm1,-] his own life in the  future. After growing up, once [vp9,-] he made his mind? nothing [fm3,-] could change it. When he  graduated from the high school, there were two choices for him, one is Beijing  University, the other a herbalist college. In spite of many people's disapproval, he still  chose the latter, because he enjoyed the Chinese ancient culture and wanted to devote  himself to it. Later he achieved his aim and opened a personal clinique [fm1,-] in Qingdao,  which he is very proud of now. He is not wealthy, but very rich in spiritual world. I  still remember his intelligent words: "Do the things you like and live for yourself. "      His bravery gains my admiration, too. With only several hundred RMB he went  to Tibet alone to explore the archaic civilization. It was so venturesome that I didn't  know if he could be back safely. After a three-day-travel [fm2,-] by train, he was picked up by  a truck passing by to reach the destination. It took him about two weeks to appreciate  the nature, the religion and the life habits there. Sometimes he slept outdoors, [sn9,-]                           in his  sleeping sack. When he came back home, he looked thin and black, but his eyes were  shining. From the nice smile on his face, I felt a kind of enviable happiness.  "Sometimes you should go beyond yourself", he told me.       In addition, he hopes himself to live like a gentleman in ancient China, so he is  strict in his traits. Sometimes he goes to countryside, with his apparatus for  acupuncture, to cure the local people almost freely and search the lost medical  methods. When a patient recovers, he is very pleased, for he feels he can help them  with his own hands.      Although my brother lives an ordinary life, without sensational success, he has  something other people cannot own. In my eyes, he is so special, so impressing, and I  can't help adoring him. His thoughts and deeds always help me, guide me and inspire  me.  

<ST 4>  <band 6> <title The Confusing Man> In this article, I'll describe the person who confused me most. With the famous fistful square mustache, he was a short, thin man but was always  aggressive, adept at extemporizing and instigating. For many people, he had a  complex character, even was a fiend [sn2,-]. From his theory on races, other races were low-grade while Nordic was the noblest.  So when he became the head of his nation, he set his foot on the way of conquering  other races especially on the Jew. What he had done brought the human race agonies  and slaughters, made his name a synonym of the Satan. [sn1,-] Though his theory on races was so insane and irrational, he had the ability to  agitate others to follow him. While he was in prison, he wrote a book that made him  adored by many people. Later He became the sovereign and finally enkindled the  World War￠ò.Who can imagine he once [ad1,-] was a beggar! There is seldom person [np6,-] who can change the whole history of the world just like  him. So many people worship him, so many people hate him and so many died [vp6,-]  because of him. Having read this, maybe everyone know [vp3,-] who he is. Yes, he is Adolf Hitler. He has gone for years, but his ghost is still poisoning the world so much. Today  there are still many new Nazis, some of who even has [vp3,-] entered the Austrian cabinet.  Why his theory can make so many people infatuated, both in 1930s and now?  He had done great injuries to the world. I wish there won't be a second! A Teacher of Mine     When I was still a young boy in the senior middle school, I was impressed  deeply by my teacher of language and literature course. Even now, I often miss him,  and write to him. What he has given me is not only knowledge, but also the basic  principles of treating others and facing life.     He is thin, and has a moderate stature. He is a little bald. All the time, he has a  pair of light brown glasses on his nose, and keeps his coat tidy. If he were staring at  you, you would never feel sharp. On the contrary, you would feel amiable. You could  see it [pr2,-]'s full of kindness and humor in his eyes. In short, he is the kind of person that  you can know he is a teacher at the first glance when you meet him in the street.     He is a man full of humor. Not only very interesting, but also abundant of  wisdom is his course. [sn2,-] Never is he going to adopt the dull and mechanic means to give  lessons, because he thinks this course itself should be vivid, and the purpose of it  should be to cultivate the students' ability [cc3,-] of using language and their feelings of  literature appreciation. So as many ways as he can, [sn3,-] he has tried to make the students  active and the air of the classroom relaxed. For example, he often asked us to perform  in the classroom according to our understanding of the text. Almost every time, the  performance may look funny, and make all of us laugh. [vp6,-] But it did increase our interest  on the course itself. As a result, we often got high scores in the examinations.     He loves his job and his students very much. As a teacher, he knows how much  he will affect his students with even one word or a small action. In our class, he never  looked down on [vp2,-] any students, even those who never got high scores in the  examination. But it didn't mean that he wasn't strict with us. If we had made mistakes,  he would criticize us. But he would do it in a much more humor [wd2,-] way that would make  you understand that you were wrong never feeling hurt [sn6,-]. We all liked to talk with him  sometimes [sn9,-] even being criticized, because all of us knew that he loved us. He uses his  action to practice the idea that the main purpose of a teacher should be to help his  students to grow up healthily, not to make them become the people only fit [vp5,-] for  examinations. [sn1,-]     So when I got the message that he was cancered two years ago, I was very  shocked. Why is life so cruel to such a person who loves it so much. So many things,  such as his job, his students, his family and so on, is [vp3,-] needed [vp7,-] him. I can't imagine what  all of these will be without him. But he has accepted all calmly, and faced life with  great optimism. Even on the way to the operating room, he was still full of optimism.  "All will become better!", he said. What a great courage should be needed!  Fortunately, his surgery was very successful. Now, a little weak as his body is, he  can go back to the classroom to stay with his students and go on give his interesting  lessons. This is my teacher who I admire. He is not only a good teacher, but also a  beneficial friend. He uses his word and action to show me what kind of person I  should be. And now I see the direction [cc3,-]. I will try my best to be a man full of humor. [sn9,-]  love and optimism just like him.

She has a slim body and black short hair. Her  skin is white and smooth. When you look at her eyes, they seem talking [vp5,-] with you  although they are not very big. She is always smiling like blooming flowers in spring.  Staying with her, you will become happier even if you are in trouble. Because of her  prettiness, many boys regard her as their dream-lover. She is not only pretty but also clever. She is good at study and gets 'A' for almost  all the subjects. First, she learns fresh knowledge very fast. Once be [vp4,-] taught, she  will never forget it. <ST 4>  <band 6> <title Conciseness of Sentences>  It is mistakenly believed that the more words a sentence contains the better it is. Most good  writing is effective because it is not cluttered with unnecessary words.  1.	Superfluous Words and Unnecessary Repetition ?	Avoid wordiness by eliminating superfluous words and the unnecessary  repetition of ideas. Sample:   (a)	The game is played with tiny, little, round balls, which, in my opinion, I think are made  of steel. (b)	The game is played with tiny balls, which, I think are made of steel.  Task 1 Revise the following sentences, eliminating superfluous / redundant words. 1)	The mediator said that if both parties would give in a little that a satisfactory settlement could  be reached that would satisfy both parties. Revised: The mediator said that if both giving a little, a settlement would be reached. 2)	The final conclusion of the novel on which he had been working for more than five years was  disappointing to everyone who read the manuscript, and he decided to revise and change the  story. Revised: The novel on which he had been working for more than five years was disappointing to  everyone, and he decided to revise. 3)	In spite of the fact that the danger was neither tangible to the touch nor visible to the eye, it was  very real to all the dwellers and inhabitants of the village in the foot of hills that circled around  the base of Mt. Wilson. Revised: The danger was neither tangible nor visible to all the dwellers in the foot of Mt. Wilson. 4)	As you continue on in the book a little further, you will be surprised and amazed by the clever  skill of the writer of the book in weaving in together the many previously unrelated threads of  his story. Revised: As you continue on the book a little further, you will be surprised by  the skill of the writer in weaving his story.  5)	He was firmly determined to combine together both of the two divisions of the firm in order to  achieve a stronger company eventually in the long run. Revised: He was firmly determined to combine the two divisions of the firm in  order to achieve a stronger one in the long run. 6)	The president's struggle with Congress ended up in a victory for the President when the public  voted at the November election to re-elect him again to the Presidency for another term of four  years. Revised: The President's struggle with congress ended up in a victory for that he was re-elected to  the Presidency. 7)	When what the speaker was saying was not audible to our ears, I asked him to repeat again  what he had said. Revised: When not audible, I asked the speaker to repeat what he had said. 8)	Modern cars of today, unlike the old cars of yesterday, can be driven faster without danger than  the old ones. Revise: Modern cars can be driven faster without danger than the old cars.  Task 2 Revise the following wordy paragraph. Eliminate all unnecessary words but keep the ideas of the  paragraphs clear.  When we were two hundred yards away from our objective, which was a small little grove of pine  trees on the sloping side of a hill, we were confronted by a vast, wet swamp. I remembered that  during the last two weeks we had had, out of fourteen days, ten days of rain, and decided in my  own mind to send out a few scouts who might discover a way by means of which we could reach  the grove without getting out feet wet. Then, when the scouts reported back that their efforts to try  to find a dry path through the swamp had been unsuccessful, we gave up and resigned ourselves to  sloshing knee-deep through the muddy water. Revised: Two hundred yards away there was a small grove of pine trees on the slop of a hill. A  vast, wet swamp confronted us during ten days of rain. I decided to send out a few scouts to find a  dry path to the grove without getting our feet wet, but they failed. So we had to slosh knee-deep  through the muddy water.  ?	Avoid wordiness by reducing clauses to phrases and phrases to single words.  This process is known as reduction. 1)	clauses reduced to participial, gerund, or infinitive phrases 2)	clauses reduced to prepositional phrases 3)	clauses reduced to appositives 4)	clauses and phrases reduced to single words Task 3 Revise the sentences to make them more concise. 1)	We took the bus in order that we might save money. We took the bus in order to save money. 2)	After I had read "A Tale of Two Cities," I read three other novels which were written by  Dickens. After reading " A Tale of Two Cities", I read three other written by Dickens. 3)	Our seats in which we sat at the Army-Navy game were on the forty-yard line, and they were at  the top of the stadium. Out seats at the Army-Navy game were on the forty-yard line on the top of the  stadium. 4)	The poetry of France has had an influence which is notable on the poetry of England. The poetry of France has had an influence on the England notably. 5)	Our days that we spent in the north woods would have been perfect if it had not been for the  mosquitoes that were enormous and hungry. Our days in the north woods would have been perfect if without the enormous  and hungry mosquitoes. 6)	Isra, who is an ambitious young actress, found that the acting that she did in a stock company in  the summer gave her the experience which she needed. Isra, an ambitious young actress, found the acting done in a stock company this summer gave her  the needed experience. 7)	The most common complaint that is made by students is that every teacher chooses Friday on  which to give examinations. The most common complaint made by students is that every teacher chooses  Friday to give examinations. 8)	I was just dialing his number on the telephone when he appeared in the doorway of my office  and startled me by his unexpected appearance that I just sat glued to my chair and gazed at him  speechless, unable to get up or to say a word. Just dialing his number, he appeared in the doorway of my office startling me  by his unexpected appearance. I just sat glued to my chair and gazed at him  speechless [wd4,-] unable to get up or to say a word. 9)	After we had returned together again, my roommate and I decided that we would rush  immediately to the bus station in the hope of catching up with and joining the rest of our group. After returning together again, my roommate and I decided to rush  immediately to the bus station in the hope of catching up with our group. 10)	Because of the fact that I can borrow free, without charge, the latest, most recent books from  the public library, if I simply have patience enough to wait my turn, I do not usually as a rule  use the lending library which is in the bookstore which charges a daily fee of so much per day. Because of the fact that I can borrow free, latest books from the public library, if patient enough to  wait my turn, I usually do not need to use the lending library in the bookstrore [fm1,-] charging so much  per day.   
<ST 4>  <band 6> <title My Mother> My mother is the woman I admire most. She is an ordinary woman of medium  height. Although she is about 60 years old and her hair is already silvering with gray,  she looks vigorous with two sharp eyes in her face. She had worked in a factroy for  about 30 years as a senior engineer and she was retired from the business when she  was 55.  My mother has many good virtues. She teaches me a lot of principles of how to  be a good man: being warmhearted, being hardworking and being responsible for  what you did. My mother is very kindhearted. She likes to help others, whether an acquaintance  or a stranger. She also teaches me to do so. When I was in junior high school, my  parents brought a boy from our shirttail relative to my family. He and I were of the  same age and went to the same school. In my eyes, he was so countrified and stupid  because he came from a village. My classmates often laughed at him, sometime [fm1,-] they  laughed at me. [sn1,-] I felt I lost my face, so I often complained about it. One day, my  mother had a talk with me. It was the first time that I saw my mother weeping. She  told me that when she was still at college, my grandmother died. " At that time, so  many people helped me. Now we lives [vp3,-] much better than before, why can't we help  others? " she said. I was so impressed and embarrassed. From then on I never  complained about it. My mother is not only warmhearted, she is [wd5,-] also [cj2,-] hardworking. When she was at  college, the foreign language she learned was Russian. But her work made her have to  learn English. She was not young at that time, but she did her best to learn it. She was  so modest and often asked my old sister for advice. After years of hard studying, she  passed the English examination for a senior engineer's qualification. Last summer, I  bought a computer, she was attracted by it. [sn1,-] Now she can use many softwares expertly,  such as "Word" and "Excel" , she can also contact with me by Email and surf on  Internet. [sn1,-] Besides these two points above, what impressed me most is [vp6,-] that she taught me to  be responsible for what I did. I still remember a thing that happened 15 years ago. My  little fellows and I picked many unripe peaches from my neighbor's trees. My  neighbor was angry, but he didn't know who did it. I was afraid to tell the truth to my  family. About several months later, my nother [fm1,-] knew it. She brought me immediately  to my neighbor's house to apologize for it. She also told me:"You should be  responsible for what you did, if you don't do so, you are not a true man. [sn1,-]" When I said  sorry to my neighbor, he had already forgot it. This is my mother. She is so ordinary, but is [wd6,-] so great in my eyes. She teaches me  many things. She tells me to try my best in every trivia and in fact she does so. She is  the woman I admire most.
